dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To find... HARRY POTTER, standing numbly beside ALBUS DUMBLEDORE amidst a MOB of REPORTERS. CAMERAS FLASH. Dumbledore’s hand finds his shoulder and Harry is moving, drifting through the chaos, Dumbledore protective, graceful, dignified. CLOSEUP - HARRY’S GLASSES His eyes dart from side to side. The lenses glimmer with abstraction. We --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -+. glass, a window, its surface prickling with another kind of ambient light. We are looking INTO a conference room where office workers sit around a table. But the light has caught one worker’s eye, then another, and soon they are all rising, stepping to the window, mesmerized by what lies beyond. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 2.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WORKERS’ POV - LONDON SKYLINE Blood-red and stormy. A VORTEX of CLOUDS -- strangely ominous -- hangs high in the sky, flashing from within, as if about to rain blood over the city. We -- cuT INTO:

dialogues.speaker: THE STORM
dialogues.text: itself and... «+. PLUMMET, London expanding, stretching out on all sides. We SWEEP madly OVER Charing Cross, leaving the Muggle world behind and SWOOP INTO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+. Diagon Alley just as the front window of OLLIVANDER’S WAND SHOP EXPLODES. Witches and wizards flee. In the drifting smoke, DEATH EATERS appear, accompanied by a tall, sinewy beast of a man, FENRIR GREYBACK. With a casual sweep of his hand he sends a wizard flying and a witch screams. In deep b.g., two Death Eaters abduct a SHROUDED FIGURE (Ollivander). Greyback grins, then APPARATES, along with the others... .-. leaving Diagon Alley behind. The streets of London appear below once more, and then the river. Black trails -- the Death Eaters -- streak across the sky and then turn TRANSLUCENT as they encircle the MILLENNIUM BRIDGE. Pedestrians peer upward, bewildered, sensing a shift in the atmosphere. And then... The BRIDGE CRUMBLES into the THAMES, the image horrifyingly beautiful, as is the SOUND of it, a ROAR, a wail, the last cry of a lion. Then the image begins to FADE and all goes slowly SILENT, until only a WHISTLING WIND is heard and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+. tall grasses toss dreamily in a SLANTING RAIN. An OLD MILL lists like an ancient ruin against a charcoal sky. A DARK FIGURE (NARCISSA MALFOY) MATERIALIZES. As she turns for the town in the distance, another witch materializes: BELLATRIX LESTRANGE.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: Narcissa!  HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 3. EXT. SPINNER’S END - LATE AFTERNOON (MOMENTS LATER) 5 Like a rat in a maze, Narcissa makes her way through a labyrinth of dilapidated brick houses. Bellatrix trails.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: Cissy! You mustn’t do this. He can’t be trusted.

dialogues.speaker: NARCISSA
dialogues.text: The Dark Lord trusts him.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: The Dark Lord is mistaken. Narcissa turns, shocked. Bellatrix looks shocked herself, rain running down her cheeks. *

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: Or so I believe.

dialogues.speaker: NARCISSA
dialogues.text: Well, who can one trust these days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grim and dark, lit by guttering candles. RAIN drums the * roof eerily. A KNOCKER CLANGS. A SQUAT MAN SHUFFLES * forth, something familiar in his gait. EXT. HOUSE (SPINNER’S END) - SAME TIME - LATE AFTERNOON 7 The door cracks, spilling sallow light onto Narcissa and Bellatrix. A face: WORMTAIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sisters follow Wormtail down a narrow hallway.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: He lives in this Muggle dunghill? Wormtail glowers over his shoulder at her. They pass into...

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: «++. a room where a MAN sits by the window running with * RAIN, his face hidden by the Daily Prophet. * (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 4.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: On the front page is a PHOTOGRAPH of the MILLENNIUM BRIDGE CRASHING INTO THE THAMES. But even more prominent is the SILHOUETTE of a YOUNG WIZARD and a HEADLINE:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY POTTER
dialogues.text: Young Wizard Destined to Kill You-Know-Who? The paper drops and SEVERUS SNAPE eyes the women curiously.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Run along, Wormtail.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Snape fills the last of three goblets with wine.

dialogues.speaker: NARCISSA
dialogues.text: I’ve nowhere else to turn, Severus. Snape hands her a goblet, extends one to Bellatrix.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: You must be joking. Snape smiles faintly, brings the goblet to his own lips.

dialogues.speaker: NARCISSA
dialogues.text: I know I ought not to be here. The Dark Lord himself has forbidden me to speak of this --

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: If the Dark Lord has forbidden it, you ought not to speak. (eyes shifting) Put it down, Bella. We mustn’t touch what isn’t ours. Bellatrix, DARK CURIO in hand, glowers, sets it back down.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: As it so happens I’m aware of your situation, Narcissa.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: You? The Dark Lord told you?

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Your sister doubts me, Narcissa. Understandable. (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 5.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Over the years I have played my part well. So well I’ve deceived one of the greatest wizards of all time. Bellatrix makes a scathing sound. Snape turns, eyes hard.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Dumbledore is a great wizard. Only a fool would question it.

dialogues.speaker: NARCISSA
dialogues.text: I... I don’t doubt you, Severus.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: You should feel honored, Cissy. As should Draco --

dialogues.speaker: NARCISSA
dialogues.text: He’s just a boy!

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: I can’t change the Dark Lord's mind. But it might be possible for me to help Draco. To provide some... protection. Bellatrix eyes Snape keenly.

dialogues.speaker: NARCISSA
dialogues.text: Do you mean it, Severus?

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: I can try.

dialogues.speaker: NARCISSA
dialogues.text: Oh, Severus, please, if you would... (I would be forever in your debt.)

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: Swear to it. Snape’s eyes shift, meet Bellatrix’s challenging gaze.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: Make the Unbreakable Vow. (as Snape looks away) You see. It’s just empty words. Oh he’1l try. He'll give it his best effort. But when it matters most he’1l slither back into his hole. Bloody coward... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 11 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 6.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bellatrix goes on MUTTERING as she splashes some wine into a goblet. Snape turns back, anger flashing in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Take out your wand. Bellatrix freezes, goblet to her lips. As she lowers it, a rivulet of red runs out of the corner of her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Snape faces Narcissa. Bellatrix, hand faintly trembling, places the tip of her wand over their LINKED hands.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: Will you, Severus Snape, watch over Draco Malfoy as he attempts to fulfill the Dark Lord’s wishes.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: I will. A SINGLE STRAND of LIQUID FIRE issues from Bellatrix’s wand and wends its way around their hands.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: And will you, to the best of your ability, protect him from harm?

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: I will. A SECOND STRAND of FIRE intertwines with the first.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: And should it prove necessary, if it seems Draco will fail... will you yourself carry out the deed that the Dark Lord has ordered Draco to perform? Snape’s hand TWITCHES within Narcissa’s. Bellatrix waits.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRAIN blasts through the station.  12 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 7. EXT. “TREATS” FOOD STAND - SAME TIME - NIGHT 12 Late. Lonely men and women loiter on the platform. Ata food stand, patrons grimly read their TABLOID of choice. CAMERA TRACKS PAST The Daily Mail, The Sun, The Mirror -- LANDS ON... the Daily Prophet. The SILHOUETTE. The HEADLINE: “HARRY POTTER: THE CHOSEN ONE?” But the (unseen) reader is fixated on a SMALLER ITEM, tucked at the bottom corner of the back page: “Malfoy Sentenced to Azkaban.” TWO PHOTOGRAPHS accompany the piece, one of LUCIUS MALFOY, another of Narcissa and DRACO MALFOY as they exit a courtroom. Draco’s eyes look distant, haunted.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Harry Potter. Who’s Harry Potter? The paper drops, reveals... Harry. He glances up at the YOUNG WAITRESS who stands over him. Pretty. Very pretty.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh. Um. No one. Bit of a tosser. As she leans over to clear his chips wrappings, Harry's gaze drifts over the smooth skin of her neck, the spray of freckles across one cheek...

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Funny that paper of yours. Couple nights ago, I could swear I saw one of the pictures move.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Thought I’d gone round the twist. She makes a face, smiles. A smile to die for. Starts to go.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hey. I was wondering...

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Eleven. That’s when I get off. (the smile) You can tell me all about that tosser Harry Potter. Harry watches her go, then quickly reaches into his coat and fumbles out a S’Mints container. Just then... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12 13 14 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 8.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: «+. a LIGHT on the opposite PLATFORM FLICKERS. Harry looks. It FLICKERS again and this time a small cloud of GLITTERING DUST dances over the opposite platform. As a TRAIN ROARS past, Harry squints through the flickering windows and watches the dust transform into... ALBUS DUMBLEDORE. Leveling his glasses, he peers across the platform, smiles and gives Harry a wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Harry arrives, he finds Dumbledore studying a PERFUME ADVERTISEMENT which shows a MODEL with a WAND in her teeth: “Tonight Make a Little Magic With Your Man.”

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I once knew a Muggle girl from Liverpool with hair like spun silk. No light could resist it... (turning) You've been reckless this summer, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I like riding round on the trains. It takes my mind off... things. Harry hesitates, notices Dumbledore’s hand is ASH BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Rather unpleasant to behold, isn’t it? The tale is thrilling if I do say so myself, but I’m afraid now is not the time to tell it. Take my arm. (extending it) Do as I say. Harry glances across the platform, sees the freckled Waitress appear, eye his empty table. Slowly, he reaches out and -- instantly -- all goes BLACK in a RUSH of SOUND and FURY, as if Harry had been pitched headlong into a tornado. Seconds later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... he re-emerges into the world, reeling, eyes stinging with tears. Slowly, his planet stops spinning.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I just Apparated, didn’t I? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14 15 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 9.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Indeed. And quite successfully I might add. Most people vomit their first time.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Can’t imagine why...

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Dumbledore leads Harry up a steep narrow street lined with darkened houses.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Welcome to the charming village of Budleigh Babberton, Harry. I assume right about now you’re wondering why I’ve brought you here, am I right?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (glancing about) After all these years, I just sort of roll with it, sir. Dumbledore smiles mildly, then pauses, his face darkening. Before them stands a SMALL STONE HOUSE. But something is wrong about the place.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Wand out, Harry. INT. SLUGHORN'’S HOUSE - SAME TIME - NIGHT 15 THROUGH a crack in the front door: Dumbledore and Harry move swiftly up the walk and enter.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Lumos... The tip of Dumbledore’s WAND BLAZES. He sweeps the shadows. CALLS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Horace! Nothing. Dumbledore points his wand down a NARROW HALLWAY. Motes of dust dance in the wandlight, but nothing else. He starts down the hallway, toward the OPEN DOORWAY at its end. Slowly, the room beyond comes

dialogues.speaker: INTO VIEW
dialogues.text: 16 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 10. INT. SLUGHORN’S HOUSE - SITTING ROOM - NIGHT 16 Utter devastation. A GRANDFATHER CLOCK lays upon the floor, its face cracked. A PIANO sags in the corner, keys strewn like teeth upon the rug. A copy of the Daily Prophet trembles in the breeze from a half-open window. As Harry looks, a DROP of something WET strikes the word “CHOSEN.” His gaze rises. He GASPS. A substance DARK and GLUTINOUS is spattered upon the ceiling. Dumbledore raises his wand. The ceiling SCREAMS RED. Another drop falls and this one strikes Harry’s SCAR. As Harry moves to wipe it away, Dumbledore grabs his hand. Training his light on Harry’s forehead, Dumbledore flicks a blackened finger over the scar. Brings it to his tongue. Reacts. Turning, his eyes narrow on an OVERSTUFFED ARMCHAIR. Moving to it, he JABS his wand into the plump seat cushion.

dialogues.speaker: ARMCHAIR
dialogues.text: Merlin's Beard! Instantly, the Armchair mutates into HUMAN FORM, though briefly gets caught inbetween. After a bit of GRUMBLING, SEAM-SPLITTING and the POPPING of a cushion button or two, a FAT OLD MAN (HORACE SLUGHORN) in a pair of WELL- WORN lilac pajamas appears.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: (rubbing his rump) There’s no need to disfigure me, Albus!

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I must say, you make a very convincing armchair, Horace.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: It’s all in the upholstery. (patting his stomach) I come by the stuffing naturally. What gave me away?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: (nodding to the ceiling) Dragon's blood.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Yes, well, I couldn’t very well use wizard’s blood, could I? Oho! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 11.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Slughorn takes a step back, having spotted Harry. The blood on Harry’s forehead only serves to highlight his scar.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Ah yes. Introductions. Harry, this is an old friend and colleague of mine, Horace Slughorn. Horace, this is, well, you know who this is. (a droll whisper) Apparently there’s some thought he may be the Chosen One. Slughorn stares at Harry as if hypnotized.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: So why all the theatrics, Horace? You weren’t perhaps expecting someone else, were you?

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: (blinking) S-someone else? I’m sure I don’t know what you mean. Dumbledore raises an eyebrow. Slughorn caves.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Oh all right! The Death Eaters have been trying to recruit me for over a year. Do you know what that’s like? One can only say no to these people so many times before they...

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Take matters into their own hands? Slughorn eyes Dumbledore miserably, gestures.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: I never stay anywhere more than a week. The Muggles who own this place are in the Canary Islands.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Well, I think it should be put back in order for them, don’t you? Mind? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 12.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dumbledore raises his wand. Instantly, the grandfather clock resumes its rightful place, shattered lanterns re- ignite and the blood on the ceiling evaporates -- just as the piano keys tumble back into place with a pleasant MUSICAL run.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: That was fun. May I use the loo? As Dumbledore heads down the hall, Slughorn calls after.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Don’t think I don’t know why you’re here, Albus! The answer is still no! Absolutely, unequivocally no! Dumbledore doesn’t respond. Slughorn glances at Harry. The silence is palpable. Awkward. A beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: You look very like your father. Except for your eyes. You’ve got --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: My mother’s eyes, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: (smiling softly) Lily. Lovely Lily. She was exceedingly bright -- your mother. Even more impressive when one considers she was Muggle-born.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: One of my best friends is Muggle- born. She’s the best in our year.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Oh, but you mustn’t think I’m prejudiced! No, no, no! Your mother was one of my absolute favorites! Look, there she is. Right up front. Slughorn waves to a dresser crowded with PHOTOGRAPHS.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: All mine, each and every one. Ex- students, I mean. You recognize Barnubas Cuffe, of course, editor of the Daily Prophet. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 17 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 13.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Always takes my owl should I want to register my opinion on the news of the day. And there’s Ambrosius Flume of Honeydukes. Sends a hamper of chocolate to the house each birthday. That is, when I had a house. And Gwenog Jones, captain of the Holyhead Harpies -- free tickets whenever I want them. Of course, I haven’t been to a match in some time... Harry steps forward, takes a picture of one particular BOY, a boy who resembles... Sirius. Seeing Harry thus distracted, he studies him intently, like a rare object.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Ah yes. Regulus Black. You no doubt know of his older brother Sirius. Died a few weeks ago. I taught the whole Black family except Sirius. Shame. Talented boy. I got Regulus when he came along, of course, but I’d have liked the set.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Mind if I take this? I do love knitting patterns. Slughorn blinks, looks away from Harry and finds Dumbledore standing there, clutching a MUGGLE MAGAZINE.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Of course. But you’re not leaving?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I think I know a lost cause when I see one. Regrettable. I would have considered it a personal triumph had you consented to return to Hogwarts, Horace. You are, like my friend Mr. Potter -- one of a kind. EXT. SLUGHORN’S HOUSE - NIGHT (MOMENTS LATER) 17 Dumbledore HUMS placidly as he and Harry make their way down the walk. Seconds later, the front door swings (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 14.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: All right! I’11 do it. But I’1l be wanting Professor Merrythought’s old office, not that water closet I had formerly. And I expect a raise! These are mad times we live in! Mad!

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Indeed they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumbledore leads Harry back toward the Village Square.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sir, exactly what was that all --

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: You are talented, famous and powerful -- everything Horace values. Professor Slughorn is going to try to collect you, Harry. You would be his crowning jewel. That is why he is returning to Hogwarts. And it is crucial he return... Harry looks intrigued by this last statement, but before he can pursue it, Dumbledore glances ruefully at the moon.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I fear I may have stolen a wondrous night from you, Harry. She was, truthfully, very pretty. The girl.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s alright, sir. I’11 go back tomorrow, make some excuse -- Harry stops. Dumbledore is shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: You’1l not be going back to Little Whinging tonight, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But, sir. What about Hedwig? And there’s my trunk -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18 19 20 21 22 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 15.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Both are waiting for you. Dumbledore extends his arm. Mystified, Harry reaches out. As his fingers touch the silk of Dumbledore’s cloak, he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... APPARATES INTO VIEW, stumbling to one knee and wincing.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sir? Dumbledore is gone. Harry rises, glances about. In the distance a CROOKED HOUSE shimmers. A PRETTY GIRL with RED HAIR flits briefly past an upstairs window. GINNY WEASLEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginny DASHES down a vertiginous staircase, flies into the kitchen and finds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a LARGE TRUNK and an OWL CAGE. Curious, she cocks her head to one side. The owl does the same in return.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Hedwig...? Mum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GINNY'S POV, looking up -- a dizzying perspective of twisting railings and crooked bedroom doors. A CLOCK hangs IN VIEW, bearing NINE HANDS, each inscribed with a Weasley name, each pointing to MORTAL PERIL. MRS. WEASLEY appears, looks down.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: What is it, Ginny? Is it your father? Has something happened at the Ministry? Has he been kidnapped? Is it the Death Eaters?

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Exactly. How’d you guess? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 16.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mrs. Weasley throws her hands up over her face.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: I’m joking, Mum.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: You're worse than Fred and George.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Now you're joking. I was only wondering when Harry got here.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Harry who?

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Harry Dimpleton. Harry Potter, of course.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: I think I’d know if Harry Potter was in my house, wouldn’t I?

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Well his trunk’s in the kitchen. And his owl.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: I seriously doubt that. Just then, HEDWIG SCREECHES 0.S. Ginny gives her an I- told-you-so when another door opens and RON WEASLEY looks down.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Harry? Did someone say Harry?

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Me, nosy. Is he up there with you?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: ‘Course not. Think I’d know if my best friend was in my room, wouldn’t I? Another door opens: HERMIONE, in a robe, TOOTHBRUSH in hand.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Was that an owl I heard? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22 23 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 17.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Harry's. Haven’t seen him, have you? Apparently, he’s wandering about the house.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Really. Ginny spins. Harry. Standing in the doorway of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: RON/HERMIONE/MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Harry! As the others rocket downstairs, Ginny gives Harry a great grinning hug. There is something oddly charged in the moment, a surprise to both of them. The others arrive. More hugs.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: But why didn’t you tell us you were coming?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Didn‘t know. (a shrug) Dumbledore.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: That man. But then, what would we do without him? Ron! Ron is about to touch Hermione. She retracts her neck.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You've a bit of... He gestures to the stray lace of toothpaste on Hermione’s chin. Quickly she wipes it off, gives him an odd look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Daily Prophet tumbles within a makeshift campfire of BLUE FLAMES, but magically doesn’t disintegrate. Harry teases the fire with the tip of his wand, where The Chosen One? mingles with Draco’s haunted face in the flames.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: When’d you get here? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 23 24 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 18.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: A few days ago. Though... for a bit, I wasn’t sure I was coming. Harry looks up, sees her glance at Ron.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Mum sort of lost it last week. Said Ginny and I had no business going back to Hogwarts. That it’s too dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh come on...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: She’s not alone. Even my parents -- and they’re Muggles -- know something bad is happening.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Anyway, Dad stepped in, told her she was being barmy. Took a day or two, but she came round.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But we’re talking about Hogwarts. Dumbledore. What could be safer? Hermione and Ron exchange another glance.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: There’s been a lot of chatter lately. That he’s gotten... old.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Rubbish. He’s only -- what?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: A hundred and fifty. Give or take a few years. Silence. Nods. Then the three break out laughing. Grow quiet again. Harry takes another poke at the Prophet. Draco’s haunted face appears briefly, then is gone.

dialogues.speaker: SHOPPING BAG
dialogues.text: bearing Weasley’s Wizard Wheezes clutched in the hand of a boy being pulled by his mother through the throng packed sardine-tight in the store. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 19.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It’s utter madness: Ever-Bashing Boomerangs whip through the air, Dr. Filibuster’s Fabulous Wet-Start No-Heat fireworks spit sparks, and Nose-Biting Teacups bare tiny porcelain teeth. FRED & GEORGE WEASLEY, in SCREAMING MAGENTA, stand upon a counter, selling to the masses:

dialogues.speaker: FRED/GEORGE
dialogues.text: Step up! Step up!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: We've got Fainting Fancy...

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Nosebleed Nougats...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: And just in time for school...

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Puking Pastilles! A BOY stops chewing, turns PALE GREEN -- literally.

dialogues.speaker: FRED/GEORGE
dialogues.text: Into the cauldron, handsome. Together, with the tips of their toes, Fred and George launch a SLOSHING CAULDRON down the counter, drop down on either side of Harry, begin to steer him through the store.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: What’d you think, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (to a browsing boy) Pocket that and you’1l pay in more than Galleons, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: FRED/GEORGE
dialogues.text: We've got eyes in the back of our heads. The boy, working a SCREAMING YO-YO, blanches as Fred and George turn, reveal they do in fact have EYES IN THE BACK OF THEIR HEADS -- phony, but unnerving. As the EYES WINK, the tiny boy bolts.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Bloody urchins. Harry eyes a display of ORANGE AND BLACK LUMPS. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 19A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: George dro; Ginny and Love Potio:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Peruvian Instant Darkness Powder?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: A real money spinner that.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Handy if you need to make a quick escape. Hello, ladies! ps one of the lumps in Harry’s hand, turns to Hermione, who peruse a display of “Wonder Witch ns.”

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yes, they do really work.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Then again, the way we hear it, sis, you're doing just fine on your own.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Are you not currently dating Dean Thomas? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 20.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry pretends to consider a rack of “Ten-Second Pimple Vanisher,” but secretly eavesdrops.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: None of your business.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: These are adorable. Inside a cage, small round BALLS of FLUFF roll about, SQUEAK.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Aren’t they now. Pygmy Puffs. Can't breed them fast enough. Just then a HUGE BOY (CORMAC McLAGGEN) passes behind Hermione and, with his eyes, takes the full measure of her. Noticing, she turns, receives a faint smile as he moves on.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: How much for this? A TINY WOODEN MAN ascends a TINY GALLOWS and... DROPS. George rides a rolling ladder INTO FRAME, drops next to Fred.

dialogues.speaker: FRED/GEORGE
dialogues.text: Five Galleons.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: How much for me?

dialogues.speaker: FRED/GEORGE
dialogues.text: Five Galleons.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: But I’m your brother!

dialogues.speaker: FRED/GEORGE
dialogues.text: Ten Galleons.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: C’mon. Let’s go. The trio head for the door, passing LAVENDER BROWN, who smiles flirtatiously at an oblivious Ron.

dialogues.speaker: LAVENDER BROWN
dialogues.text: Hi, Ron.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: 25 26 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun fades over an IRON ARCHWAY -- Welcome to Diagon Alley! -- as Harry, Ron and Hermione pass beneath. All around them, SHOPS sit silent, windows BOARDED-UP or SHATTERED. People scurry by, avoiding the SCARY FACES of the witches and wizards who peer out from the SECURITY POSTERS plastered to every LAMP POST. Bellatrix is there: “KNOWN DEATH EATER,” And Greyback: “WEREWOLF.” And LUCIUS MALFOY: “CAUGHT.”

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: How is it Fred and George are doing it? Half the alley’s closed down.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Fred reckons people need a laugh these days.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Reckon he’s right... Harry eyes the poster of Bellatrix, her mocking half- smile.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Oh no. Look. Harry and Ron follow her gaze to the wreck that is Ollivander’s Wand Shop.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: But everyone got their wands from Ollivander. Young. Old...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Good. Bad. Speaking of which... Across the avenue, DRACO MALFOY and Narcissa pause, glance around, then slip quickly down an alley.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Is it just me? Or do Draco and mummy look like two people who don’t want to be followed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio trail Draco and Narcissa, who navigate these dark streets with ease. Hermione, lagging a bit, glances up at the darkening sky. When she looks back, she sees Ron and Harry far ahead. They turn a shadowy corner, vanish. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 26 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 22.

dialogues.speaker: SHOP FRONT
dialogues.text: Harry and Ron duck inside a shop front. At the end of the alley, a single shop glimmers dully: Borgin & Burkes. Narcissa and Draco enter, greet a STOOPED MAN (BORGIN). He POINTS. Draco walks to a LACQUERED CABINET, plays his fingers over its glassy surface. Narcissa speaks and Draco turns, finds Borgin holding the curtain to the back room aside. Draco hesitates, then follows his mother through.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What're they playing at?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dunno. Let’s get closer.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (a nod; stopping) Hey. Where’s Hermione?

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER ALLEY
dialogues.text: Hermione moves through the shadows, alone, peering down side streets, each darker than the next, lost, but holding it together, when... a SHADOW FLICKERS overhead. She looks up, sees a FIGURE (Greyback) leap from one roof to another. She stands perfectly still, then... hears VOICES.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER ALLEYS
dialogues.text: Harry and Ron race down one passage then another. Stop.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Harry, where is she?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I’m turned around.

dialogues.speaker: BORGIN
dialogues.text: Hermione creeps to the end of a narrow passage, toward the VOICES, and finds herself... behind Borgin & Burkes. FIGURES encircle an old cauldron, among them Greyback, Bellatrix, Narcissa, and in the very center... Draco. Hermione squints against the brilliance of the FIRE, the FIGURES twisting like Giacomettis. Draco extends his left arm... when a SHADOW falls over Hermione, fingers find her arm. She wheels, terrified. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 26 27 28 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 23.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ron.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Bloody hell.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Sorry. Just then, the cauldron EXPLODES with light. Instantly, the group, including Draco, disperses.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What just happened?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Harry stares at the SMOKE drifting from the cauldron. A SOUND RISES, growing more powerful and the ROAR of a...

dialogues.speaker: LATE AFTERNOON 27
dialogues.text: ... TRAIN overtakes us, the scarlet stack of the Hogwarts Express churning furiously towards the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Quibbler...? Quibbler...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUNA LOVEGOOD moves down the aisle wearing a pair of RED and BLUE CARDBOARD GLASSES (SPECTRESPECS) identical to the ones modeled by a witch on the cover of the current issue of The Quibbler, a stack of which Luna clutches to her chest.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: There’s an article on Wrackspurts this month. Quibbler...? The loitering STUDENTS ignore her, including DEAN THOMAS, currently WHISPERING to Ginny, who smiles mildly, more interested in the PURPLE PYGMY PUFF perched on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: He’s lovely. They’ve been known to sing on Boxing Day, you know. Quibbler?

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Please. What's a Wrackspurt? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28 29 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 24.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: They're invisible creatures that float in through your ears and make your brain go fuzzy. (moving off) Quibbler? Quibbler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Ron and Hermione sit together. Hermione has a book entitled Advance Rune Translation open on her lap, while Ron lets Harry’s INVISIBILITY CLOAK play through his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Don’t you see, it was a ceremony. An initiation.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Stop, Harry, I know where you’re going with this --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s happened. He’s one of them.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: One of what?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry is under the impression that Draco Malfoy is now a Death Eater.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You're barking. What would You- Know-Who want with a sod like Malfoy?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So what’s he doing in Borgin and Burke’s? Browsing for furniture?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It’s a creepy shop. He’s a creepy bloke.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Look. His father’s a Death Eater. It only makes sense. Besides, Hermione saw it. With her own eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I told you. I don’t know what I saw. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 29 30 31 32 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 25.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry rises, snatches the cloak from Ron’s hands.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I need some air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blood-red sun shimmers through the windows, staining the interior a deep scarlet. Students read, play cards. In one compartment, CRABBE and GOYLE slumber sloppily. As Harry enters, the ACCORDION doors to the NEXT CAR SQUALL open and a PAIR of TWIN GIRLS emerge. He watches them when a VOICE causes him to turn back. As the accordion doors slowly close, he spies Malfoy sitting with PANSY PARKINSON and a BOY with the cheekbones of a sphinx (BLAISE ZABINI). Harry studies Malfoy when a BOY pushes through the accordion doors. As they begin to close, slowly, Harry reaches into his pocket and removes the ORANGE AND BLACK LUMP Fred gave him in Diagon Alley. He eyes Malfoy, eyes the closing door and -- impulsively -- pitches the lump into the air. It soars through the narrowing crease of the doors and -- just as Malfoy glances his way -- just as it reaches the apex of its flight -- POOF! -- explodes softly, raining DARK POWDER.

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: One train car -- and only one -- goes DARK:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAOS. PANICKED VOICES. Then, like a thinning mist, the darkness eerily recedes, the red light of dusk returns and Malfoy is revealed, standing in the DOORWAY of the car. As he looks on warily, students return to their seats. Across the way, Crabbe & Goyle continue to slumber.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: What just happened? Blaise?

dialogues.speaker: BLAISE
dialogues.text: (tense himself) Don’t know. Just then, a SMALL BAG TEETERS... then tumbles from a luggage rack. Malfoy wheels, eyes the bag. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32 33 34 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, boys. The lights went out is all. Come, Draco. We’1l be at Hogwarts before you know it. She pats the seat. Draco eyes the bag, slings it back onto the luggage rack and plops down. Pansy strokes his hair.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: Hogwarts. What a pathetic excuse for a school. I think I’d pitch myself off the Astronomy Tower if I thought I had to continue on for another two years. Pansy, gently twisting one of Draco’s locks, stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What’s that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: Let’s just say I don’t think you'll be seeing me wasting my time in Charms Class next year. Confused, Pansy glances at Blaise, who snorts derisively.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: Amused, Blaise? We'll see just who’s laughing in the end. Blaise shakes his head, smiling as he looks out the window at the darkness. Just then the small bag in the upper rack shifts. Malfoy’s eyes play over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hogwarts Express steams into the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron and Hermione step into the crowded aisle.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Where’s Harry?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Probably on the platform. C’mon.  35 36 37 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Blaise and Pansy make to exit, Malfoy takes down the small bag, grips the handle thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: You two go on. I want to check something. Malfoy slides shut the door. LETS THE BLINDS DOWN. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: Didn’t mummy ever tell you it’s bad manners to eavesdrop, Potter? Petrificus Totalus! Malfoy wheels, points his wand at the luggage rack. Something hits the floor with a THUMP. The Invisibility Cloak slips away and reveals Harry, paralyzed on the floor. Malfoy grins.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: Oh, right, she was dead before you could wipe the drool off your chin. Malfoy brings his boot down hard on Harry’s face. SNAP! Blood squirts from Harry’s nose. Malfoy snatches up the Invisibility Cloak, pitches it over Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: Enjoy the ride back to London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malfoy steps off, pulls his cloak tight and disappears into the night. Softly, a SOUND rises, of a GIRL LIGHTLY HUMMING and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luna Lovegood wanders down the aisle HUMMING, red and blue Spectrespecs wobbling on the bridge of her nose. Up ahead one compartment’s BLINDS are shut. Luna stops HUMMING. Cocks her head curiously. As she does, the LIGHT from an overhead lantern kicks off the cheap plastic lenses of her glasses and, for the briefest of seconds, a FLUTTERING CLOUD appears. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 37 38 39 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 28.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Of tiny insects. Or pixie dust. Or a trick of the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luna’s SILHOUETTE SWELLS over the blinds, then the door opens. She calmly draws her wand and sends forth a blast of RED LIGHT. The Invisibility Cloak slithers from Harry's body.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Hello, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Luna. How'd you...?

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Wrackspurts. Your head’s full of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The castle glitters. Harry, face blood-spattered, nose slightly off-center, approaches with Luna.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sorry I made you miss the carriages, Luna.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: It’s alright. I enjoyed our walk. It was like being with a friend.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I am your friend, Luna.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: That’s nice. Just then PROFESSOR FLITWICK rushes forth clutching a long roll of PARCHMENT bearing all students’ names.

dialogues.speaker: FLITWICK
dialogues.text: About time! I’ve been looking all over for you two. Names.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Professor Flitwick, you've known me for five years.

dialogues.speaker: FLITWICK
dialogues.text: No exceptions, Potter. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 29.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Who are those people? Harry turns, sees Luna staring into the darkness, where SHADOWS drift eerily, like ghosts.

dialogues.speaker: FLITWICK
dialogues.text: Aurors. For security.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s a not a cane, you cretin. It’s a walking stick. Harry and Luna turn. Draco stands amidst a mountain of TRUNKS and OWL CAGES, watching Filch pass a long SECURITY DETECTOR over a WALKING STICK.

dialogues.speaker: FILCH
dialogues.text: And what exactly would you be wanting with a walking stick?

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: It was his father’s. Snape separates from the shadows. Draco eyes him warily, then snatches the stick from Filch.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: Is my father’s. He’s not dead. Snape watches Malfoy carefully wrap the stick in felt, lay it back inside his trunk.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: It’s alright, Mr. Filch. I can vouch for Mr. Malfoy. Draco eyes Snape warily again, then begins to slouch off, catches Harry looking.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: Nice face, Potter. Harry puts a hand to his nose, watches Malfoy disappear into the darkness, trailed by Snape.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Would you like me to fix it? Personally I think you look a bit more devil-may-care this way. But it’s up to you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Have you ever fixed one? A nose. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 29A.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: No. But I’ve done several toes and how different are they really? This does not fill Harry with confidence. Nevertheless...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What the hell. Give it a go. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 30.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Episkey. Luna poises her wand over Harry’s nose and... gives it a TAP. It VIBRATES WILDLY and then... SNAPS into place.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well? How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Exceptionally ordinary.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione cranes her neck, looking for Harry, while Ron stuffs his face with pudding, MUMBLING, MOUTH FULL:

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Don’ you worry. He'll be ‘long soon ‘nuff --

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (whacking him) Will. You. Stop. Eating! Your best friend is missing!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Oi! Turn around, you lunatic. Hermione spins, sees Harry and Luna approaching. In the light of the hall, Harry’s blood-spattered face is quite the sight.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: He’s covered in blood again. Why is it he’s always covered in blood?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Looks like his own this time.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (as he arrives) Where’ve you been, Harry? And what happened to your face?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Later. What’ve I missed? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 31.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (shrugging; still eating) Sorting Hat urged us all to be brave and strong in these troubled times -- easy for it to say -- it’s a hat, isn’t it? First Years seemed to enjoy it, though. Wankers. Filch give you the wand outside? Harry nods. Ginny, damp napkin in hand, begins to dab his face, then feels suddenly awkward. Harry takes it from her.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Thanks... Just then, the light in the Hall begins to gently dim and all eyes turn to Dumbledore, standing at the top of the Hall, ashen hand raised to the enchanted ceiling, where clouds respond to his gestures and shroud a gleaming full moon.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What’s happened to his hand?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: The very best of evenings to you! First off, please join me in welcoming the newest member of our staff, Horace Slughorn. MILD APPLAUSE ensues. Harry claps perfunctorily, his eyes drifting to the entrance of the Hall as a pair of Aurors station themselves just outside.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Professor Slughorn, I’m happy to say, has agreed to resume his old post of Potions master. Meanwhile the post of Defense Against the Dark Arts will be assumed by Professor Snape. This is greeted by stunned silence. Dumbledore frowns, then attempts to generate something by CLAPPING his hands once. A few Slytherins join in and some dim-witted First Years.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Now, as you know, each and every one of you was searched upon your arrival tonight. You have a right to know why. (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40 4l HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 32.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (a beat) Once there was a young man who, like you, sat in this very Hall. Walked this castle’s corridors. Slept beneath its roof. He seemed, to all the world, a student like any other. His name? Tom Riddle. The Hall goes utterly silent.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Today, of course, the world knows him by another name. Which is why, as I stand looking out upon you all tonight, I am reminded of a sobering fact. Each day, every hour, this very minute perhaps, dark forces attempt to penetrate this castle. But in the end, their greatest weapon remains... you. Harry eyes Malfoy, slouched low, lazily levitating a fork with his wand, as if Dumbledore were unworthy of attention.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Just something to keep in mind. Now, off to bed. Pip pip!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (as they rise) That was cheerful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TEEMING MASS of STUDENTS fight their way to class on first day of term. Amidst it all, McGonagall stands tall and stern. The twins pass by, bearing identical looks of consternation. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL History of Magic is up, ladies, not down. Mr. Davies -- that’s the girl’s toilet... McGonagall’s eyes shift, find Harry and Ron sitting upon a ledge, clearly deriving immense pleasure from the chaos. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Potter! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 33. 4l CONTINUED: 41 Harry’s smile droops. McGonagall beckons with a finger.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: This can’t be good. Ron grins as Harry makes his way “upstream” to McGonagall. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Enjoying ourself, are we?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, you see, I’ve got an open period this morning, Professor -- PROFESSOR McGONAGALL So I noticed. I would think you’d want to fill it with Potions. Or is it no longer your ambition to become an Auror?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It is. Or was. But I was told I had to get an Outstanding in my

dialogues.speaker: O.W.L. --
dialogues.text: PROFESSOR McGONAGALL And so you did when Professor Snape was teaching Potions. However, Professor Slughorn is perfectly happy to accept N.E.W.T. students with ‘Exceeds Expectations.’

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Really? Well... brilliant. I/’11 head there straight away. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Good. And take Weasley with you. He looks far too happy over there. 42 INT. CORRIDOR/SLUGHORN’S CLASSROOM - MORNING (MOMENTS

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Ron trails Harry toward an open door.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: But I don’t want to take Potions!  HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 34. 43 INT. SLUGHORN’S CLASSROOM —- CONTINUOUS ACTION - MORNI As Harry drags Ron inside, the other students turn in unison. Hermione frowns. Lavender, seeing Ron, beams.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Harry m’boy! I was beginning to worry! And I see we've brought someone with us...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Ron Weasley, sir. But I’m dead awful at Potions, a menace actually, so I probably should just be going --

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Nonsense, we’ll sort you out. Any friend of Harry’s is a friend of mine. Right then, books out --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Um, sorry, sir, but I haven’t got my book yet -- nor’s Ron. You see -- (until this morning...)

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Not to worry. You can get what you need from the cupboard. As Harry and Ron step to the cupboard, Slughorn resumes, gesturing to the cauldrons bubbling before him.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Now, as I was saying, I’ve prepared a few concoctions this morning. Any ideas what these might be? Yes, Miss...?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Granger, sir. That one there is Veritaserum. And that would be Polyjuice Potion. And that... In the cupboard, Harry and Ron find two TEXTBOOKS -- one new, one shabby and soiled. Both snatch for the new when a box -- marked “BEZOARS” -- tips. As Harry makes a grab for it, Ron wrests free the new textbook and goes off grinning.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: ... is Amortentia! The most powerful love potion in the world. (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 35.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s rumored to smell differently to each person, according to what attracts them. For example, I smell freshly mown grass and new parchment and spearmint toothpaste -- Hermione blushes, stops herself. Slughorn regards her.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: One of my best friends is Muggle- born. She's the best in our year... Harry, settling into his seat with the soiled textbook, looks up just as Slughorn’s eyes shift to him for confirmation. As Harry nods, Hermione glances curiously at him.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Now Amortentia doesn’t create actual love, of course. That’s impossible. But it does cause a powerful infatuation or obsession. For that reason, it is probably the most dangerous potion in this room. Slughorn turns, finds a sea of dreamy faces leaning into the VAPORS. Instantly, he CLANGS a cover onto the cauldron, bringing them round. As Ron blinks, he finds Lavender still staring dreamily -- at him. Noticing, Hermione’s eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE BELL
dialogues.text: Sir, you haven’t told us what’s in that one.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Ah yes... Slughorn steps to a SMALL BLACK CAULDRON. Begins to ladle a bit of GOLDEN LIQUID into a TINY VIAL.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: What you see before you, ladies and gentlemen, is a curious little potion known as Felix Felicis. But it is more commonly referred to as --

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Liquid luck. A buzz runs through the class. Even Malfoy perks up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 36.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Yes, Miss Granger. Desperately tricky to make. Disastrous should you get it wrong. But brewed correctly, as this has been, it has remarkable powers. One sip and you will find that all your endeavors succeed... at least until the effects wear off.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE BELL
dialogues.text: But then why don’t people drink it all the time?

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Because taken in excess it causes giddiness, recklessness and dangerous overconfidence.

dialogues.speaker: BLAISE
dialogues.text: Have you ever taken it, sir?

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Twice. Once when I was twenty- four. Once when I was fifty- seven. Two tablespoons taken at breakfast. Two perfect days... Slughorn eyes the vial dreamily, adrift. Finally he blinks.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: So. This is what I offer each of you today. One tiny vial of liquid luck... to the student who, in the hour that remains, manages to brew an acceptable Draught of Living Death, the recipe for which can be found on page ten of your textbook. Excitement seizes the class. Slughorn smiles knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: You should know that in all the years of my previous tenure at Hogwarts, not once did a student brew a potion of sufficient quality to claim this prize. In any event -- good luck. Slughorn sets the vial upon his desk, where it SHIMMERS in a SHAFT of SUNLIGHT. Harry opens his book. Frowns. The MARGINS of the page before him are black with the tight SCRIBBLINGS of a previous owner. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 37.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The same CREEPY GRAFFITI fills the next page as well, on and on throughout the book. Shaking his head, Harry runs his finger under the first PRINTED INSTRUCTION: “Cut up one Sopophorous bean.” Harry takes the SILVER DAGGER upon his desk, poises it over the BEAN when... Ron’s bean shoots across the room and bounces off Katie Bell’s head. Harry surveys the rest of the room: everyone is struggling to cut the resistant legume. He glances back to his book, considers the instruction again. As ARROW has been drawn from the word “Cut” to the margin, where a modification has been written in the tight scrawl: “Crush with blade -- releases juice better.” Harry considers the dagger in his hand, then places the flat of the blade against the bean and presses. Instantly, the protective parchment covering the desk runs RED with juice.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: How did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Crush it. Don’t cut it.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No. The instructions specifically say to cut.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. Really --

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Sh! Harry shrugs, lifts the parchment and tips the juice into his cauldron. It HISSES, then turns LILAC. Harry grins. CAMERA BEGINS SLOW DOLLY TOWARDS the vial of Felix Felicis and...

dialogues.speaker: BEGINS
dialogues.text: Students struggle. A cauldron overflows. Lavender eyes Ron. CAMERA CREEPS TOWARD VIAL. THE SUNLIGHT SHIFTS. Hermione grows more and more frustrated. Her hair grows bushier in the steam rising from her cauldron... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 44 45 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 38.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry’s finger traces under the official instruction... then drifts to the spidery scrawl in the margin... Malfoy cuts himself, curses... CAMERA CREEPS CLOSER TO VIAL. SUNLIGHT SHIFTS AGAIN. Harry, cool as a cucumber, adds one last ingredient, steps back, done... Hermione, hair like Medea now, glowers at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slughorn wends his way amongst the cauldrons, nodding with sympathy at the fiascos before him. Then... he stops, staring in disbelief at the pearly sheen of one bubbling potion.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Merlin’s Beard! But it’s perfect. So perfect I daresay one sip would kill us all! Your mother was a dab hand at potions, but this... My, my, what can’t you do, m’boy? Perhaps you will save us all in the end... All eyes turn to Harry. His smile falters.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Here you are then, as promised. One bottle of Felix Felicis. Use it well. Slowly, Harry reaches out... takes the glittering vial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Castle is dark, but for one WINDOW. INT. DUMBLEDORE’S OFFICE - SAME TIME - NIGHT 45 Dumbledore sits alone at his desk, the deep lines of his face illuminated by the shimmering PENSIEVE. TWO OBJECTS of note are before him. One is a BLACK-STONED RING. The other is TOM RIDDLE’S DIARY. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 39.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He briefly balances the ring upon the tip of an ashen finger, then turns a page of the battered diary. His face is troubled. A KNOCK. He takes the ring and diary, slips them inside a drawer. The door swings open, reveals Harry.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Good evening, Harry. You got my message, I see. Come, come. Sit. Harry steps forward, eyes the Pensieve curiously. Sits.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: So. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Fine, sir.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Enjoying your classes? Professor Slughorn, for one, is most impressed with you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I think he overestimates my abilities, sir.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Definitely. Dumbledore smiles affectionately, nods.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: And what of your activities outside the classroom? Do they bring you satisfaction?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I notice you spend a great deal of time with Miss Granger. One can’t help but wonder if --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No! I mean... she’s brilliant. And we're friends. But... no.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Forgive me, Harry, I... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45 46 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 40.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dumbledore smiles faintly, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: «+. I was merely curious. (rising) In any event, I’m sure you’re wondering why I’ve summoned you here tonight. The answer lies here. Dumbledore swings open a cabinet where DOZENS upon DOZENS of GLITTERING VIALS stand like tiny glimmering soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: What you see before you are memories. In this case pertaining to one individual: Voldemort. Or as he was known then... Tom Riddle. Dumbledore reaches down with his damaged hand and removes a stoppered VIAL, dusty and veined with age.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: This vial contains a most particular memory -- of the day I first met him. I'd like you to see it. If you would... Dumbledore extends his ashen hand and Harry rises, gingerly takes the vial and removes the cork. He tips the contents into the Pensieve. Dumbledore nods and Harry leans into the iridescent liquid, his face breaking the surface...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: A horse-drawn MILK CART rattles across a RAIN-SWEPT London street and a YOUNG DUMBLEDORE appears in a PLUM VELVET SUIT. We TRACK him down the street (and see him eye a LOVELY LASS appreciatively) until he reaches a GRIM BUILDING surrounded by IRON GATES. As Dumbledore passes through, CAMERA RISES: WOOL’ S ORPHANAGE The IMAGE SHUDDERS and we --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 47 48 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 4l.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A skinny, sharp-featured woman, MRS. COLE, leads Dumbledore down a drab corridor. CHILDREN’S VOICES carry from an unseen COURTYARD, splashing and shrieking, in the midst of some game.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. COLE
dialogues.text: I must confess to a bit of confusion upon receiving your letter, Mr. Dumbledore. In all the years Tom’s been here, he’s never once had a family visitor. Frankly, I was stunned to find that someone knew of his existence.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I am not family. But his name has been known to me since birth.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. COLE
dialogues.text: I see... But she doesn’t really. She stops, frowns.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. COLE
dialogues.text: I think I should tell you. He’s a funny boy -- Tom. Odd. There have been incidents with the other children. Nasty things.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Perhaps you could give me an example. Mrs. Cole starts to speak, then shakes her head, moves off. As Dumbledore makes to follow, his eyes happen upon a FRAMED PHOTOGRAPH on the wall, old and yellowing, depicting a SEASIDE SCENE of a SHARP ROCK OUTCROPPING and a CAVE. As he exits, we HOLD ON it. NEW ANGLE - CORRIDOR OUTSIDE TOM RIDDLE’S ROOM Mrs. Cole’s hand appears. KNOCKS. She turns the KNOB. INT. ORPHANAGE - RIDDLE’S ROOM - PENSIEVE - DAY 48 A small room, grim and shadowy. TOM RIDDLE, 11 years old, sits atop a bed, hands in lap. The walls CRAWL with REFLECTED RAIN, oozing like oil down a grimy window. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 41a.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. COLE
dialogues.text: You’ve got a visitor, Tom. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 42.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dumbledore steps forward, extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: How do you do, Tom. Riddle eyes Dumbledore briefly, looks away.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. COLE
dialogues.text: Well, I’1l leave you two to yourselves. Mrs. Cole exits, closing the door. Dumbledore studies Riddle, then begins to tour the room. Carefully placed upon a low shelf are some ODD SOUVENIRS. A grouping of SEVEN STONES... A book containing SEVEN MATCHES. SEVEN BRASS KEYS... Moving on, Dumbledore passes a TALL CABINET, tracing his FINGERS over its surface, as if the wood’s grain were Braille, as if somehow “seeing” what lies within. Then Dumbledore pauses. Strewn on a small table are a grouping of SEVEN DARK DRAWINGS. A BOY and GIRL, their faces anguished. A sea-swept CAVE. The same cave from the photograph. Dumbledore begins to reach out...

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Don’t. Dumbledore stops, turns. Finds Riddle’s level gaze on him.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: As you wish. Riddle looks away and Dumbledore, for the first time, notices his hands. They are splayed, utterly still, and INTERLACED with a SILKY WEB, where a SPIDER knits back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: You're the doctor, aren’t you?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: No. I ama Professor.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: I don’t believe you. I hear Mrs. Cole talking, her and the rest of the staff. They want me looked at. They think I’m different.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Perhaps they’re right. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 43.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: I’m not mad.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Hogwarts is not a place for mad people. Riddle looks up, cocks his head ever-so-slightly.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: It’s a school. A school of... magic. Riddle stays looking, but says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: You can do things, can’t you, Tom? Things the other children can’t. Riddle eyes Dumbledore intensely, unblinking.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Tell me some of the things you can do, Tom.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: (watching the spider) I can make things move -- without touching them. I can make animals do what I want without training them. I can make bad things happen to people who are mean to me. I can make them hurt... if I want. Dumbledore studies Riddle -- then the boy looks up.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I’m like you, Tom. Different. Riddle closes his hands and the web collapses.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Prove it. It is not a request. Without breaking his gaze, Dumbledore’s eyes narrow ever-so-slightly and... the WARDROBE BURSTS INTO FLAMES. Riddle wheels. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 43a.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Slowly smiles. Dumbledore studies him. Abruptly, the wardrobe begins to SHAKE. Riddle’s smile fades. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 44,

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I think there is something trying to get out of your wardrobe, Tom. Open it. Open. It. Terrified, Riddle steps to the burning wardrobe and throws open the door. On the topmost shelf, above a rail of threadbare clothes, a SMALL BOX SHAKES VIOLENTLY.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Take it out. As Riddle’s fingers touch the box, the flames engulfing the wardrobe vanish, but the box continues to SHAKE -- the only sound in the now-silent room.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Is there anything in that box you ought not to have? Riddle eyes Dumbledore, a trifle fearfully this time. He spills the box onto the bed: a YO-YO, a silver THIMBLE, and a tarnished MOUTH ORGAN.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Why did you want these things, Tom?

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: (looking off) I like having things that belonged to other people. It makes me feel +++ close to them. Dumbledore studies Riddle’s profile, pondering this.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Thievery is not tolerated at Hogwarts. At Hogwarts, you will be taught not only how to use magic, but to control it. Understood? (as Riddle nods) I‘ll be going now, Tom. Leave your window open tonight. An owl will bring you a message. Read it carefully. Dumbledore starts to exit, when:

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: I can speak to snakes too. Dumbledore stops and we are ON his face, his back to Riddle. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48 49 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 45.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: They find me. Whisper things. Is that normal. For someone like me?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: It is unusual. But not unheard of. Dumbledore exits then, without a backward glance, leaving 11-year-old Tom Riddle alone. The IMAGE SHUDDERS and... INT. DUMBLEDORE’S OFFICE - NIGHT (PRESENT) 49 ... Harry and Dumbledore reappear. The room has grown DIM in their absence. Dumbledore gestures. LAMPS BLAZE to LIFE.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Did you know, sir? Then?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Did I know that I had just met the most dangerous Dark Wizard of all time? No. Had I... Dumbledore falters, his expression troubled. Harry looks up from the Pensieve, where young Tom Riddle’s fragmented face floats on the surface, eyes Dumbledore.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Over time, while here at Hogwarts, Tom Riddle grew close to one particular teacher. Can you guess which teacher that might be?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You didn’t bring Professor Slughorn back simply to teach Potions, did you, sir?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: No. I did not. You see, Professor Slughorn possesses something I desire very dearly. And he will not part with it easily... (eyeing Harry knowingly) I’d rather not divulge any more just yet, Harry. But I promise. In time you will know everything. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 46.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You said Professor Slughorn would try to collect me.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Do you want me to let him? Dumbledore trails his ashen fingers in the surface of the Pensieve, vanquishing young Tom Riddle’s face.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry tries -- with little success -- to get the attention of the throng of aspiring Quidditch players assembled on the pitch.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: All right! Queue up! Excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: SHUT IT
dialogues.text: Instant silence. Harry frowns, nods to Ginny nevertheless.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Thanks. All right. This morning I‘1l be putting you all through a few drills to assess your strengths. But know this: Just because you made the team last year does not guarantee you a spot this year. Is that clear? Ron looks unnerved at this, sweating so much he’s attracted a PESKY FLY. CORMAC McLAGGEN, the huge boy from Weasley’s Wizard Wheezes, sidles up.

dialogues.speaker: CORMAC
dialogues.text: No hard feelings, Weasley, alright?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hard feelings? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 47.

dialogues.speaker: CORMAC
dialogues.text: I‘ll be going out for Keeper as well. Nothing personal.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Really? Strapping guy like you, you’ve got a Beater’s build, don’t you think? Keeper needs to be agile, quick -- Cormac nabs the FLY between two fingers, kills the BUZZ.

dialogues.speaker: CORMAC
dialogues.text: I like my chances. Say... think you could introduce me to your friend Granger? Wouldn’t mind getting on a first name basis, know what I mean? Cormac gives a lewd wink, saunters off. Ron glances up to the stands. Hermione smiles, waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginny flies swiftly, handling the Quaffle with ease. TWO SECOND YEARS collide in mid-air. Cormac makes a brilliant save. Ron makes a shaky save. Hermione looks on, nervous for him. Katie Bell snatches a Quaffle with one hand, splits two defenders beautifully and makes a slick blind pass to Dean who jets high in the air, then lets the Quaffle roll off his fingers... right into Ginny’s hands as she races below. Seamus sends a Bludger rocketing into the stands, scatters a group of onlookers, leaving only Neville, who sidles delicately to the right as the others leg it. TWO THIRD YEARS collide in mid-air. Cormac makes a brilliant save. Ron turns the wrong way but makes the save anyway as the Quaffle caroms off the tail of his broom. Hermione looks on more nervously. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 ATA.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DEMELZA ROBINS, bent low over her stick, pins the Quaffle under her chin, splits two Bludgers and a pair of Beaters. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 48.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TWO FOURTH YEARS collide in mid-air. Two aspiring Beaters “whiff” on a pair of Bludgers, whack each other instead and plummet to the pitch as the Bludgers ricochet off one another and go flying into the stands, scattering onlookers yet again and leaving, as before, only Neville. This time, he sidles delicately to the left. Cormac makes a brilliant save. The Quaffle bounces off Ron’s head. Hermione looks on extremely nervously. TWO FIFTH YEARS collide in mid-air. END MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The survivors press ICE PACKS to their heads, run TAPE round twisted fingers. Only Ron, hovering at the west goal, and Cormac, hovering at the east, remain on the pitch. Luna, Spectrespecs in place, eyes Cormac -- cool, confident, clear. Then eyes Ron -- sweaty, nervous, SWARMING in WRACKSPURTS.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: All right. Cormac. Ron. It’s down to you two for Keeper. We’ll decide it with a shootout. Demelza, you’1ll bring the Quaffle up against Cormac. Ginny, you’ll take on Ron.

dialogues.speaker: CORMAC
dialogues.text: Hang on. She’s his sister. How do I know she won’t toss him a floater?

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Piss off, Cormac. How ‘bout I toss you a floater?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Quiet! I’m Captain. We do it my way. Now line up. On three. One. Two... Three! Demelza and Ginny rocket forth. Ron weaves nervously while Cormac hovers in place, a confident sneer on his face. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 51 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 49.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (under his breath) C’mon, Ron... Demelza hunkers over her broom once again, flying like an arrow, then goes into a wide, sweeping slide. Ginny blasts over the pitch, ginger hair streaming like flames, then rolls recklessly to the side. As one, they both let fly... Hermione, face buried in her fingers, MUTTERS SOMETHING. Cormac, at the last moment, inexplicably rolls his broom to the right and the Quaffle sails over his shoulder. Ron, zig-zagging crazily, nearly falls off, rights himself in a panic, and deflects Ginny’s Quaffle... with his forehead. As a few partisan CHEERS erupt from the stands, Harry grins, then has to restrain himself. Hermione opens her eyes slowly.

dialogues.speaker: LAVENDER BROWN
dialogues.text: Isn’t he brilliant? Hermione stares balefully at Lavender, then notices Cormac eyeing his broom incredulously. She gets up, slips away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry scans his Potions book. Hermione peruses the Prophet. Ron cracks walnuts, pitching the pieces into the fire.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Have to admit, thought I was going to miss that last one. Hope Cormac’s not taking it too hard. Behind her paper, Hermione rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Has a bit of a thing for you, Hermione. Cormac.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: He’s vile. Ron considers this, then glances across the room at Lavender.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ever heard of this spell? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 50.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry points to a notation in the margin underlined three times: “Sectumsempra. For Enemies.” Hermione frowns.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No I have not. And if you had a shred of self-respect you would turn that book in.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Not bloody likely. He’s top of the class. Even better than you, Hermione. Slughorn thinks he’s a genius. Hermione casts Ron a withering glance.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I’d like to know just whose book that was. Let’s take a look, shall we?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (holding it out of reach) No.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (suspicious) Why not?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s... old. The binding is fragile.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: The binding is fragile? She makes another grab for it, but Harry holds it clear. Then Ginny appears, plucks it out of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Who’s the Half-Blood Prince?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE/RON
dialogues.text: The who?

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: That’s what it says. Right here. ‘This Book is the Property of the Half-Blood Prince.’ (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 51 52 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 51.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
