dialogues.text: Ginny points. Written on the frontispiece is: “This Book is the Property of the Half-Blood Prince.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students lean into a bitter wind, trudging through deep snow.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: For weeks you carry around this book, practically sleep with it... and you have no desire to find out who The Half-Blood Prince is?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I didn’t say I wasn’t curious. And, by the way, I don’t sleep with it.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (a sarcastic chortle) Yeah. Right. (as Harry glares) Well, it’s true. I like a nice chat before I go to bed. Now you're always reading that bloody book. It’s like being with Hermione. This time it’s Hermione’s turn to glare.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Well, I was curious. So I went to --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY/RON
dialogues.text: The library.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: And... nothing. There’s no reference to the Half-Blood Prince anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Good. That settles it then. Hermione starts to object, when:

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Hey, you three! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 52.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HAGRID emerges out of the trees, beard crusted in white, looking like a crazed Father Christmas. Behind him, deep in the woods, DARK SILHOUETTES -- AURORS -- can be seen. Hermione eyes them briefly, then nods to the PULSATING BURLAP BAG Hagrid clutches in his fist.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What’ve you got there, Hagrid? Hagrid tips open the bag. The trio grimace. Hagrid CHUCKLES.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Stinksap. Burn the whiskers right off yer chin. Trees ‘ere are drippin’ with it.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Stinksap? You’re not sick, are you?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: It’s not fer me. It’s fer Aragog. Yeh remember Aragog, don’ yeh?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Spider? About six feet tall? Ten feet wide?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Tha’s the one. He’s taken ill. I’m hopin’ ter nurse ‘im back. Keep yer fingers crossed. Hagrid crosses his fingers. Ron forces a grin, does the same, shakes his head as Hagrid disappears back into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Barking. Does he not remember that raving arachnid tried to eat us? What? Ron sees Hermione staring at the Aurors again.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: The Aurors. I know they’re here to protect us, but... somehow I don’t feel any safer. Just then Harry spies Slughorn, heading down towards the Village, passing a weary Flitwick coming the other way. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 52A.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Filius! I was hoping to find you at the Three Broomsticks.

dialogues.speaker: FLITWICK
dialogues.text: Emergency choir practice, I’m afraid, Horace. Harry watches Slughorn continue on toward the Village. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52 53 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 53.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Who's up for a Butterbeer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the trio enter, Harry glances round, locates Slughorn at the bar, planted plumply on a stool.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. Over here. Hermione and Ron, in the midst of seating themselves at a perfectly acceptable -- and clean -- table, see Harry seat himself at one strewn with the detritus of a previous customer -- but which puts him in direct view of Slughorn. They exchange a glance, shrug, join Harry. Ron starts to take the chair directly opposite Harry -- blocking his view.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, no. Sit next to me. Ron stops, exchanges another glance with Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: O-kay. A SKINNY KID in an apron appears, tosses a FILTHY RAG upon the table -- which begins to wipe the surface on its own. Harry cranes his neck around the kid to keep Slughorn in view.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY KID
dialogues.text: What’1l we have?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Three Butterbeers. Splash of ginger in mine, please. The kid WHISTLES and the rag leaps back into his pocket. Harry continues to eye Slughorn, when he sees Draco. They lock eyes briefly, then Draco exits.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Aw, bloody hell... Harry turns, sees Ron glowering at Ginny, who sits ina dark corner with Dean, their faces lit by a guttering candle.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Oh, honestly, Ronald. They’re just holding hands... (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 54.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (as Dean kisses Ginny) And snogging.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’d like to leave.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Leave? You can’t be serious.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: That happens to be my sister.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: So? What if she looked over here and saw you snogging me? Would you expect her to get up and leave? Ron blinks, utterly speechless. Then:

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Harry, m'boy! Slughorn’s voice BOOMS so loudly even Ginny jumps -- and catches Harry looking. As Slughorn waddles over, SLOSHING mug in hand, Harry rises immediately -- an action so grossly out of character that Hermione regards him with amused curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hello, sir. Wonderful to see you. Hermione, brow wrinkling, turns to Ron, silently mouths: wonderful to see you?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So what brings you here, sir?

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Oh, the Three Broomsticks and I go way back. Longer than I’d care to admit. In fact, I remember when it was simply One Broomstick! As Slughorn GUFFAWS, Harry joins in, LAUGHING HEARTILY as well. Slughorn’s belly trembles next to Hermione’s cheek and his waving mug sloshes over, spattering the table.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Oops! All hands on deck, Granger! Hermione smiles thinly, when a WHISTLE is heard and the FILTHY RAG is back, whisking away Slughorn’s mess as the SKINNY KID slides three foaming mugs onto the table. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 55.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: (In the b.g. Katie Bell emerges from the back, starts for the exit. Her friend LEANNE follows her out.)

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Listen, m’boy. In the old days, I used to throw together the occasional supper and invite a select student or two. Would you be game?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’d consider it an honor, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: You'd be welcome too, Granger. Hermione, in the midst of emptying her Butterbeer in one long draw, SLAMS down her mug -- leaving behind a “mustache.”

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Be delighted, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Brilliant. Look for my owl. (exiting, to Ron) Good to see you, Wallenby. Ron frowns as Slughorn waddles away, turns to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What're you playing at?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dumbledore asked me to... get to know him.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Get to know him?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dunno. But it must be important. Otherwise Dumbledore wouldn’t ask. Slam! Ron turns, sees that Hermione has emptied his mug as well. Ron gestures to her upper lip.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Um... You’ve got a little... Without a thought, she flicks her tongue up, wipes it clean.  54 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snow falls heavily now. Ron and Harry walk together, while Hermione trails several yards behind, pirouetting happily, letting snowflakes fall on her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Bit worried about her. Did you hear that rubbish she was talking back in the pub? Her and me snogging. Ha. As if...

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Katie. You don’t know what it could be! Up ahead, Katie Bell and Leanne stand in the drifting snow, ARGUING. Katie holds a SLENDER PACKAGE. Hermione comes bumping up, drapes her arms over the boys.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What’s up? At that very instant, Katie Bell RISES SIX FEET INTO THE AIR. Hair dancing violently in the wind, her face remains eerily placid. Then she... SCREAMS. Harry and Ron DASH FORWARD, seize her ankles. At their touch, she FALLS to the snow, THRASHING and SHRIEKING, EYES ROLLED UP in her skull.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: I warned her! I warned her not to touch it! Hermione looks. Lying in the snow is the PACKAGE, TORN.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Harry, she’s swallowing her tongue --

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I’ll get someone --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: There’s no time! Suddenly, a MASSIVE FIGURE LURCHES out of the WHITE: Hagrid.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Get back! All o’ yeh! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 54 55 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 57.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He says this so forcefully the others instantly obey. Effortlessly, he scoops up Katie’s thrashing body and then, as if calming a terrified animal, presses his face close to hers and WHISPERS with great TENDERNESS:

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Now, now. Now, now... Over and over he repeats this, soothingly, the words like a mantra, until Katie’s lids flutter and her body goes limp.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Don’ go touchin’ tha’ but by the wrappin’s. Unnerstan’? Hagrid nods darkly to the package in the snow. Harry kneels. Poking through the paper is an ORNATE OPAL NECKLACE. Taking off his scarf he carefully enfolds package and rises. Then, along with the others, he watches Hagrid lumber off, Katie cradled in his arms. In seconds they are swallowed by the snow. The only sound is the ROAR of the WIND. INT. McGONAGALL’S OFFICE - LATER (LATE AFTERNOON) 55 The necklace lies green and glittering upon McGonagall’s desk. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL You’re sure Katie did not have this in her possession when she entered the Three Broomsticks, Leanne?

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: It’s like I said. She went to the loo and when she came back she had the package. She said it was important she deliver it. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Did she say to whom? Leanne shakes her head. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL All right, Leanne. You may go. (as Leanne exits) Why is it always you three? Hm? When something happens? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 58.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Believe me, Professor, I’ve been asking myself the same question for six years. Just then, Snape appears at the door, eyes the trio. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Severus.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Is this it? McGonagall nods. Snape takes his wand, lifts the necklace like a dead snake. Eyes it with fascination. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: I think Miss Bell is lucky to be alive.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: She was cursed, wasn’t she? I know Katie. Off the Quidditch pitch she wouldn’t hurt a fly. If she was bringing that to someone, she wasn’t doing it knowingly. Snape eyes Harry levelly. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Yes. She was cursed.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It was Malfoy. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL That’s a very serious accusation, Potter.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Indeed. Your evidence?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I... just... know.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: You... just... know. Once again you astonish with your gifts, Potter, gifts mere mortals could only dream of possessing. How grand it must be to be the Chosen One. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 55 56 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 59.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ron and Hermione avert their eyes uncomfortably. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL I suggest you return to your dormitory. All of you. INT. BOYS’ DORMITORY (GRYFFINDOR TOWER) - NIGHT 56 Harry and Ron lie awake in the darkened dormitory. Ron stares at the ceiling. Harry eyes “Malfoy” on the Marauder’s Map.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What do you suppose Dean sees in her? Ginny.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What does she see in him?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Dean? He’s brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You called him a slick git not five hours ago.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, he was running his hands all over my sister, wasn’t he? Something snaps. You’ve got to hate him. You know, on principle.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (troubled by this) I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: So what is it? He sees in her?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. She’s smart. Funny. Attractive...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Attractive?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You know. She’s... got nice skin.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Skin? You’re saying Dean’s dating my sister because of her skin? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 56 57 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 60.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, no. I mean... I’m just saying it could be a contributing factor. Silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hermione’s got nice skin. Wouldn’t you say? As skin goes, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’ve never really thought about it. But I suppose, yeah. Very nice. Another silence. Suddenly it feels weird.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I think I’1ll be going to sleep now.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Right. Harry sets the Map aside. We HOLD. Malfoy’s DOT moves down the 7th Floor corridor... and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A toast! INT. SLUGHORN’S OFFICE - NIGHT 57 Slughorn stands at the head of a table, goblet raised to the students seated before him, which in addition to Harry and Hermione include MARCUS BELBY, Blaise Zabini, NEVILLE LONGBOTTOM and the TWINS. A distinctive CRYSTAL HOURGLASS sits in the center of the table.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: To Hogwarts’ best and brightest!

dialogues.speaker: CORMAC
dialogues.text: Here, here! Hermione exchanges a wry glance with Harry, who notices that ONE SETTING is EMPTY. The twins make -- and drink -- their toast in perfect unison. Neville stares hopelessly at the vast array of forks, knives and spoons placed beside his plate.

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: Which one do I use for the soup? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 61.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hermione grins, looks up, and gets a WINK from Cormac.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: So tell me, Cormac. See much of your Uncle Tiberius these days?

dialogues.speaker: CORMAC
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. In fact, I’m meant to go hunting with him and the Minister for Magic over holiday.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Well, be sure to give them both my best. What about your uncle, Belby? Working on anything new? (to the others) For those of you who don’t know, Marcus’ uncle invented the Wolfsbane Potion. As he speaks, Belby never once looks up from his plate.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS BELBY
dialogues.text: Dunno. He and me dad don’t get on. Probably because Dad thinks potions are rubbish. Says the only potion worth having is a stiff one at the end of the -- (day. )

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: And you, Miss Granger? What is it your family does in the Muggle world?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: My parents are dentists. They tend to people’s teeth.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Fascinating. And is that considered a dangerous profession?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No. Though, a boy named Robbie Fenwick did bite my father once. Needed ten stitches. As Slughorn nods, the door GROANS. Everyone turns. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Miss Weasley! Come in, come in.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Sorry, I'm not ordinarily late -- 61A. 57 She falters, eyes red, uncharacteristically flustered. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 57 58 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 62.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: No matter. You’1ll be just in time for dessert. That is -- if Belby leaves you any. As Ginny moves to her seat, Hermione WHISPERS to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Look at her eyes. They’ve been fighting again. Her and Dean. Harry nods, then stands as Ginny reaches the table -- the only one. Hermione notices, eyes him with amusement as he sits.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Nothing. As Hermione smiles, she lightly strokes the crystal hourglass with a finger and we --

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. SLUGHORN’S OFFICE - NIGHT (LATER) 58 ... LATER, the sand having run out with the evening. Slughorn says his goodbyes.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Thank you, one and all, for a most stimulating evening. We’1l have to do it again. Slughorn closes the door, turns, sends a FLOOR LAMP WOBBLING and, catching it, finds Harry.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Oh. Potter.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir, I was just admiring your hourglass.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Ah, yes. A most intriguing object. The sands run in accordance to the quality of the conversation. When it is stimulating, the sands run slow. When it is not... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 63.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I think I’1l be going.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Nonsense. You have nothing to fear, m’boy. As for some of your classmates, well, let’s just say, they’re unlikely to make the shelf. Slughorn steps to a makeshift bar, begins to construct a drink.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The shelf, sir? Slughorn gestures to the PHOTOGRAPHS seen earlier, now ranged like a menagerie atop a low bookcase. Once again, Lily Potter and Regulus Black up front.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Anyone who aspires to be anyone hopes to end up here. Then again... you are already someone aren’t you, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t really know how to answer that, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Your mother was modest too. Your father not so much. As you can see, he did not make the shelf. Slughorn smiles genially, turns back to his drink, using a pair of TONGS to drop ice into his glass.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Did Voldemort ever make the shelf, sir? Slughorn stiffens, his back to Harry. His hand trembles and the ice slips from the tongs. Harry notices.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You knew him, didn’t you, sir? Tom Riddle. You were his teacher.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Mr. Riddle had many teachers while here at Hogwarts.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What was he like? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58 59 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 64.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry can see the vein in Slughorn’s temple pulsating. Fearing he may have overstepped...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, sir. Forgive me. He killed my parents, you see... Harry stops, frowns. Slughorn turns, studies Harry. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Of course. It’s only natural that you should want to know more. I’m afraid I must disappoint you, Harry. When I first met young Mr. Riddle, he was simply a quiet, albeit brilliant, boy committed to becoming a first-rate wizard. Not unlike the others I’ve known. In fact, not unlike... you. If the monster existed, it was buried deep within.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOURGLASS
dialogues.text: Nary a grain trickles through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron enters the Hall, eyes lowered, knuckles taped for Quidditch, flexing his fingers anxiously as he makes for the Gryffindor table. Neville passes going the other way.

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: Good luck, eh, Ron? Ron nods shortly, then Seamus comes up on his side, WHISPERS CONSPIRATORIALLY.

dialogues.speaker: SEAMUS
dialogues.text: Counting on you, Ron. I’ve two Galleons on Gryffindor. As Seamus peels off, Ron cuts his eyes toward the Slytherin table, where the Quidditch team sits together. One Slytherin juts his chin toward Ron, MUTTERS something. A few turn, snigger. Ron averts his eyes and... almost runs into Cormac, who eyes him with disdain as he passes. Frowning, Ron drops down opposite Harry and Hermione. Harry eyes him briefly, knowingly, pushes a plate across. Ron takes a fork, pokes at it glumly. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 64A.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: So. How was it? Hermione continues to read the Prophet, unaware of Ron's mood.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: How was what?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (with mock refinement) Your dinner party.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Dead boring. Though I think Harry enjoyed dessert. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 65.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry’s eyes shift, find Hermione smiling faintly from behind the Prophet.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Ol’ Sluggy’s having a Christmas do, you know. And we’re meant to bring someone...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I expect you’1l be going with McLaggen. Isn’t he a member of the Slug Club?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Actually, I was going to ask you.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Really. But seeing as you have such a distaste for the idea --

dialogues.speaker: LAVENDER BROWN
dialogues.text: (passing by) Good luck today, Ron! I know you'll be brilliant! Ron smiles feebly, looks back down at his plate. Hermione stares daggers.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’m resigning. After today’s match. McLaggen can have my spot. Hearing this, Hermione turns back. Harry catches her eye, extends a SHAKING HAND to indicate Ron’s mental state.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Have it your way. Juice? Hermione blinks, surprised by Harry’s callousness. Ron is surprised as well -- and mildly put out.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Sure... As Harry pours, Luna arrives at the table wearing a HAT that bears an uncanny resemblance to a real lion.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Hello, everyone. You look dreadful, Ron. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 65A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ron nods grimly, lifts his glass. Luna turns to Harry. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 59 60 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 66.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Is that why you just put something in his cup. Is it a tonic? The tiny vial of Felix Felicis glints in Harry’s palm.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Don’t drink that, Ron! But Ron’s frozen in mid-sip, looking at Harry’s palm too. Quickly, he gulps down the rest.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You could be expelled for that.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dunno what you’re talking about. Harry pockets the vial, winks at Luna. Ron rises.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: C'mon, Harry. We've got a game to win.

dialogues.speaker: QUAFFLE
dialogues.text: As it ROCKETS into the AIR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly, Slytherin snatches the Quaffle and rushes en masse toward Gryffindor’s end, weaving and passing with wicked skill, culminating in a vicious, slicing shot on goal. Just when it appears it will clear the hoop, Ron streaks out of nowhere and sends the Quaffle screaming in the opposite direction. Ginny pauses on her broom, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: What’s gotten into him? She glances up at Harry, circling high above and he grins. Just then, Dean streaks by:

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Ginny! Let’s go! Instantly, she rolls backward, jets off and races down her fellow Chasers. Flying in spread formation, Dean -- on the far wing -- starts the Quaffle “up the line” until it lands in Ginny’s hand. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 60 61 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 67.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pitching herself into a wide slide to avoid a PAIR of WHISTLING BLUDGERS, she leans recklessly off her broom and whips the Quaffle through the goal untouched. As the CROWD SCREAMS, Harry eyes the Gryffindor section, where Luna’s LION HAT ROARS, Lavender CLAPS for Ron and Hermione sits with her arms crossed, a look of supreme annoyance on her face. Harry grins, jets off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room teems with students celebrating Gryffindor’s victory. It feels like Mardi Gras. Or amosh pit. Ora riot. And Ron is right smack in the middle of it.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Weasley! Weasley! Weasley! Harry takes his backslaps on the periphery, smiling as he sips a Butterbeer and enjoys Ron’s turn in the spotlight.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Ron seems to be enjoying himself.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yep. Apparently it’s his lucky day.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t have done it, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. I suppose I could’ve just used, I dunno... a Confundus charm?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (caught ) That was different. It was tryouts. This was an actual match -- She stops. Harry dangles the vial. The SEALING WAX is UNBROKEN, the bottle full.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You didn’t put it in? (as he shakes his head) Ron only thought you did? He nods. She POPS him playfully on the arm when WHISTLES and CATCALLS rise. They turn to see what the commotion is about and find, smack dab in the center of the room... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 61 62 63 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 68.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ron and Lavender. In aclinch. Kissing. Harry stares, blinks, then turns back... to no one. His eyes shift, track Hermione as she bumps through the crowd toward the portrait hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry leaves the ROAR of the party for the QUIET of the corridor. Ahead, a door stands ajar. CHIRPING can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione sits atop a desk, a small ring of TWITTERING BIRDS circling her head. The birds change color as they orbit, from sunny yellow to a dark, angry scarlet.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Charms spell. Just practicing.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ah. Well... they’re really good.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (studying her wand) How does it feel, Harry? When you see Dean with Ginny? (off his look) I know, Harry. You're my best friend. I see how you look at her. Just then the DOOR BURSTS WIDE and Ron rushes in, pulling a GIGGLING Lavender by the hand. They stop. Take inventory.

dialogues.speaker: LAVENDER BROWN
dialogues.text: Oops. I think this room’s taken. As Lavender pulls Ron out, he cuts his VOICE LOW to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What’s with the birds? Before Harry can reply, Hermione rises, points her wand.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Oppugno! Instantly the birds race like angry red bullets toward Ron, who flees, SLAMMING SHUT the door. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 63 64 65 66 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 69.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As the birds hit the door, they EXPLODE SOFTLY into small FEATHER CLOUDS and Hermione covers her face and SOBS. Harry goes to her, hesitates, then tentatively drapes his arm over her. As she turns her face into his chest, he pulls her closer, watching as, across the room, the last scarlet feather drifts to the floor, joining the pool already there.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It feels like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH the icy window, we see Harry cradling Hermione within. As CAMERA DRIFTS AWAY, RISING THROUGH the FALLING SNOW, the VIEW EXPANDS. In the Common Room, the party rages on, while three windows down, Lavender pulls Ron into a kiss. Figures pass by windows, including one tall, pale boy standing at a WINDOW on the SEVENTH FLOOR: Malfoy. As he turns away, the castle slides FROM VIEW and the CAMERA TILTS UP TO the sky, drifting with snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tinsel decks the banisters and mistletoe droops from the ceiling. As Ron and Harry make their way down the crowded corridor, passing the BIRDCAGE, Ron walks with a new air of confidence, not exactly strutting, but close.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Look, I can’t help it if she’s got her knickers in a twist. What Lav and I have -- well, let’s just say there was no stopping it. It’s chemical. Will it last? Who knows? Point is, I’m a free agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry trails Hermione through the stacks.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: He’s at perfect liberty to kiss whomever he likes. I really couldn’t care less. Was I under the impression that he and I would be attending Slughorn’s Christmas party together? Yes. Of course, now, given the circumstances, I’ve had to make other arrangements. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 70.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Have you?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Yes. Why?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I just thought, you know, since neither one of us can take who we'd really like... maybe we'd go together. As friends.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (stopping) Why didn’t I think of that?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So who are you taking?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (evasively) Um... it’s a surprise. Besides, it’s you we need to worry about. And you can’t pick just anyone. See that girl over there. That’s Romilda Vane. Rumor has it she’s trying to slip you a love potion.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Really...? Harry considers a fine-boned GIRL with RAVEN HAIR (ROMILDA VANE). She is exquisite, an absolute work of...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (snapping fingers) Hey! She’s only interested in you because she thinks you’re the Chosen One. You know that, right?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But I am the Chosen One. Hermione cocks her head at him, exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Okay. Kidding. I’11 just ask someone I like. Someone cool.  67 68 69 70 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luna Lovegood, decked out in a set of SPANGLED SILVER ROBES, and Harry, in basic black, make their way toward the STRAINS of CHRISTMAS MUSIC, RED LANTERNS lighting their way.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: I’ve never been to this part of the castle. At least not while awake. I sleepwalk, you see. It’s why I wear shoes to bed. As Harry and Luna pass out of sight, we PICK UP Malfoy, standing in the shadows of an alcove. He watches them go, then moves off. INT. HOGWARTS CASTLE - ANOTHER CORRIDOR - SAME TIME — 68

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: In the f.g., the BIRDCAGE glimmers dully in the gray moonlight streaming through a window. Within, the TWO BIRDS huddle quietly. We RACK FOCUS and see, THROUGH the grid of wire, a FIGURE APPROACHING. Draco moves down the corridor, eyes fixed oddly ahead. He looks pale in the moonlight. In his fist he grips an APPLE. As he passes the cage, we HOLD ON the BIRDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Draco approaches. Stops. Turns to the wall. Closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA GLIDES PAST dozens of TOWERING SHELVES, dust- strewn and listing like dominoes, cluttered with all matter of strange OBJECTS. Draco appears, his legs pushing him on, wending his way through the narrow passages.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND LARGE RECTANGULAR MASS
dialogues.text: We RISE ABOVE it, watch Draco walk directly TOWARD us and stop. He stares at the solid mass before him. Reaches out and takes the fringe of the tapestry covering it. Tugs. The tapestry shivers like water to the floor, revealing... A CABINET, identical to the one in Borgin & Burkes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 71 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 72.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Draco runs a hand over the glossy finish, comes away with DUST upon his fingertips. Glancing around, he spies a BUST of a WOMAN wearing a TIARA, removes the SILK SCARF hanging from her porcelain neck and gently wipes the dust away from the cabinet. Bringing the apple up, he opens the cabinet and places it within. Shuts it. Closing his eyes, he MUTTERS a LOW INCANTATION, barely discernible. He reaches out. Opens it. The apple is gone. He closes the cabinet again. Waits. Longer this time. Finally, he opens it. Removes the apple. Rotates it. Someone has taken a BITE out of it. INT. SLUGHORN’S OFFICE - NIGHT (MOMENTS LATER) 71 FLASH! A CAMERA POPS, reveals Harry smiling with Slughorn before a PHOTOGRAPHER (ADRIAN). The ceiling and walls are draped with HANGINGS of emerald, crimson and gold, so the room feels like a tent... or the inside of a gift box. It is LOUD and packed with people.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Thank you, Adrian! (quietly to Harry) One of mine. Class of ‘78. I had hoped for more out of him, but at least the pictures are in focus. (suddenly) Oh my! Excuse me, Harry. I must greet the new Minister of Magical Transportation. Class of ‘67. (as he goes) Mingle, m’boy! Mingle! We’re all friends here. And we run the world. Harry watches Slughorn make a beeline across the room, along the way nodding to the twins, who have apparently come with each other.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Drink? Harry turns, finds Neville standing with a tray.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Neville...?

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: I didn’t make the cut for the Slug Club. It’s okay. He’s got Belby handing out towels in the loo. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 71 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 73.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 71 As Neville turns away, Harry notices a pair of GIRL’S FEET protruding from beneath a CRIMSON HANGING. His gaze rises, finds Hermione peeking out. As he moves off, we see Luna talking to a small, stout bespectacled man (ELDRED WORPLE) .

dialogues.speaker: ELDRED WORPLE
dialogues.text: Lovegood, did you say? I once encountered a seriously unbalanced man by that name at a book signing. Claimed to run a magazine...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What’re you doing? Hermione YELPS, turns, pulls Harry behind the hanging. Her hair is slightly askew, her lipstick a bit blurry. They turn,

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And what's happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Hm? Oh, I’ve just escaped -- I mean, left Cormac. Under the mistletoe.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Cormac! That's who you invited!

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I thought it would annoy Ron most. But he’s a menace. He’s got more tentacles than a Snarfalump plant.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dragon tartar? find a WAITER peeking in, tray in hand.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No thank you.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Just as well. They give one horribly bad breath.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (grabbing the tray) On second thought -- maybe it‘1l keep Cormac at bay. Oh no, here he comes! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 71 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 74.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hermione pops two of the Dragon blobs into her mouth, shoves the tray in Harry’s hand and flits away.

dialogues.speaker: PARTY
dialogues.text: Snape, looking bored, stands on the periphery of a conversation, when he sees Hermione exit one side of the hanging and Cormac enter the other.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I think she went to powder her nose. Harry looks past Cormac’s shoulder, out past the hanging and sees Slughorn laughing with a guest. Cormac plucks a dragon blob off the tray in Harry’s hand, pops it.

dialogues.speaker: CORMAC
dialogues.text: Slippery little minx, your friend. Likes to work her mouth too, doesn’t she? Yak yak yak. What is this I’m eating, by the way?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dragon balls. As Cormac’s face freezes, Harry starts to head toward Slughorn when the HANGING IS SWEAP ASIDE: Snape.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: What’s going on back here? Cormac SPEWS raw dragon all over Snape’s shoes. Snape surveys the damage, then his eyes rise darkly.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: You’ve just bought yourself a month’s detention, McLaggen. McLaggen dashes off. Harry makes to follow.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Not so quick, Potter.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I think I should rejoin the party, sir. My date...

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: +. Can surely survive your absence for another minute or two. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 71 72 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 75.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Besides, I only wish to convey a message.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: A message...?

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: From Professor Dumbledore. He asked that I give you his best and that he hopes you enjoy your holiday. You see, he’s traveling and won’t return until term resumes.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Traveling? Where? Snape merely stares a Harry silently, briefly, then exits, taking Harry’s gaze with him, to Slughorn once again, wildly gesturing with a full glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Take your hands off me, you filthy squib! A frown overtakes Slughorn’s face and he turns toward the source of the commotion, exits Harry’s view. Harry emerges from the hanging, finds Malfoy in Filch’s rough grip.

dialogues.speaker: FILCH
dialogues.text: Professor Slughorn, sir! I've just discovered this boy lurking in an upstairs corridor. He claims to have been invited to your party.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, I was gate-crashing. Happy?

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: I’1l escort him out. Draco’s eyes shift, regard Snape. He shrugs free of Filch.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: Certainly... Professor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA GLIDES in the DARKNESS. VOICES are HEARD. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 73 74 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 76.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Maybe I did hex that Bell girl. Maybe I didn't. What's it to you? Two SILHOUETTES come INTO VIEW -- Malfoy, slumped against the wall in lazy insolence, and Snape.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: I swore to protect you. I made the Unbreakable Vow --

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: I don't need protection. I was chosen for this! Out of all others. Me! And I won't fail him.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: You're afraid, Draco. You attempt to conceal it, but it’s obvious. Let me assist you --

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: No! I was chosen. This is my moment ! Malfoy exits. Then Snape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is revealed in an adjacent alcove. He’s heard all. A TRAIN is HEARD...

dialogues.speaker: DAY 73
dialogues.text: The Hogwarts Express CHUGS through a SNOWY COUNTRYSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 74
dialogues.text: Ron lies on his back, while Harry sits opposite, leafing through the Half-Blood Prince’s potions book.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Unbreakable Vow. You’re sure that’s what Snape said.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Positive. Why?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It’s just, well, you can’t break an Unbreakable Vow. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 75 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 77.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’d worked that much out for myself, funnily enough.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No, you don’t understand -- Oh, bloody hell... Lavender stands outside the compartment door. Fogging the glass with her breath, she ETCHES “Ron + Lav,” encircles it with a HEART, mimes “I miss you,” and exits with a pout.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Lovely.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: All she wants to do is snog me. My lips are getting chapped. Look.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I‘1ll take your word for it. Just then, Hermione passes by, breaks stride as she spots Lavender’s handiwork, then continues on. Ron shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So what happens? If you break an Unbreakable Vow? Ron glowers, watching as Lavender’s heart slowly VANISHES.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house glows with light and HOLIDAY MUSIC rings from the WIRELESS. Fred and George fill cups with STEAMING NOG and Mrs. Weasley and Ginny ferry plates of food.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Eat up, eat up, everyone! There's more to come! Harry sits in deep conversation with LUPIN, TONKS, and MR. WEASLEY. Ron sits by silently. Lupin looks haggard. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 78.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Draco’s plotting something, I know it, something to do with Voldemort. He’s been given a task or a mission -- and Snape was offering to help.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Voldemort has chosen Draco Malfoy for a mission?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I know it sounds mad --

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Has it occurred to you, Harry, that Snape was simply pretending to offer Draco help so that he could find out what he’s up to?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That’s not what it sounded like.

dialogues.speaker: TONKS
dialogues.text: Perhaps Harry’s right, Remus. To make an Unbreakable Vow, after all --

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: It comes down to whether or not you trust Dumbledore’s judgement. He trusts Snape. Therefore, I do.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But Dumbledore can make mistakes. He’s said it himself --

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: You’re blinded by hatred.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’m not --

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: (sharply) You are! People are disappearing, Harry. Daily. We can only put our trust in a handful of people. If we start fighting amongst ourselves, we're doomed. Tonks gives Harry a furtive glance, as if to say, “Leave it.” (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 78A.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Open up, you. Harry turns, finds Ginny, holding something in her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Don’t trust me? He obliges and she pops a SMALL TART in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s good. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 76 77 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 79.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: ‘Course ‘tis. Made them myself. She smiles at him, hooks her ginger hair over one ear and Ron plops down between them. Big brother to the rescue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within the reeds. An eerie POV. TRACKING Harry and Mr. Weasley as they walk from the house to the adjacent WORKSHOP. INT. MR. WEASLEY’S WORKSHOP - NIGHT (MOMENTS LATER) 77 Harry trails Mr. Weasley through his cluttered workshop, which is chock-a-block with MUGGLE OBJECTS: Steam irons. Toasters. Clock radios. Plugs. Lots of plugs. The PARTY can still be heard, drifting faintly from the main house.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: You’ll have to forgive Remus. It takes its toll -- his condition.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (studying him) Are you alright, Mr. Weasley? Arthur tries a smile, but it fades. He frowns, pained.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: We're being followed, all of us. Molly doesn’t leave the house most days. It’s not been easy.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (a nod, then) Did you get my owl?

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Yes, but I thought it best if I replied in person. If Dumbledore’s traveling, it’s news to the Ministry. But perhaps that’s the way Dumbledore wants it. As for Draco Malfoy -- I know a bit more.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Go on. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 77 78 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 80.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: I sent an agent to Borgin & Burkes. From what you describe, I think what you and Ron saw at the end of the summer -- the object that Draco seemed so interested in -- was a Vanishing Cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: A Vanishing Cabinet?

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: They were all the rage when Voldemort first rose to power. You can imagine the appeal. Should the Death Eaters come calling, one needed only slip inside and disappear for an hour or two. But they’re tricky contraptions. Require a tremendous amount of looking after. Eventually they fell out of favor.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What happened to it? The one at Borgin & Burkes?

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Nothing. It’s still there. Harry nods, pondering this.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Harry. You know, I went through all this before -- the last time around. Times like these -- dark times -- do funny things to people. It can bring them together and it can tear them apart. Things... speed up. It’s what happens when you don’t know if today will be your last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Similar eerie POV. On the porch, Molly and Arthur, looking middle-aged and fragile, say goodbye to Lupin and Tonks.  HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the others TALK, Lupin stands a bit off to the side, staring into the reeds. His nostrils flair subtly.

dialogues.speaker: TONKS
dialogues.text: It was delicious, Molly. Really.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: You’re sure you won't stay?

dialogues.speaker: TONKS
dialogues.text: No, we should go. (under her breath) The first night of the cycle is always the worst -- Tonks gestures vaguely to the moon. Arthur glances at Lupin. ARTHUR'S POV - LUPIN’S HAND ++. as the HAIRS on the knuckles RISE.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Remus...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry peers through the ripples of an imperfect windowpane, studying the others below. A FLOORBOARD CREAKS. He turns, watches Ginny emerge into the light, in a robe, twisting her wet hair in a towel.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Everyone gone to bed?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Soon.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: I don’t sleep these days. So I wash my hair. Silly, right? Harry just stares at her, the air prickling with silence. Ginny eyes him knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Happy Christmas, Harry.  81 82 83 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lupin continues to peer into the reeds. His PUPILS CONTRACT.

dialogues.speaker: TONKS
dialogues.text: Sweetheart...

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: There’s someone out there. I can smell him. There’s more than one -- Suddenly -- throughout the reeds -- TORCHES BLAZE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rippled window behind Harry blushes with light. Ginny’s eyes shift from Harry to the trees beyond.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Oh my god... Harry turns, his BREATH FOGGING the WINDOWPANE as, far below, FLAMES SNAKE out of the reeds and SLITHER toward the house. Bellatrix emerges, peering up through the darkness toward Harry’s SILHOUETTE, a mad grin on her face. As she SHRIEKS EERILY, his eyes flash with hatred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry bursts through the front door, wand drawn, pelts toward Bellatrix. She grins, turns, and vanishes into the reeds.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Harry, no! Flames race up the porch steps, climb the walls of the house. Lupin draws his wand and races after Harry.

dialogues.speaker: TONKS
dialogues.text: Remus ! Ron, Fred and George appear, join Arthur as he dashes toward the smoking marsh. Arthur glances back as Ginny emerges.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Ginny, stay with your mother! Without hesitation, she races for the reeds.  84 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry careens through the marsh, reeds flashing past, then spies Bellatrix. She GRINS, looking like a crazed wood nymph, then flits off, her LAUGHTER mocking him. As he pursues, FIRE SNAKES through the reeds toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, George, Ron and Arthur fan out, running full-out, their feet kicking up SPARKS as SHADOWS splinter throughout the reeds. It’s like chasing ghosts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginny, copper hair gleaming, races through the reeds. Bellatrix leads Harry on, grinning madly. Ginny comes dashing to a halt, chest heaving as she peers into the smoking marsh. A HUGE FIGURE QUIVERS through a veil of smoke. Ginny’s eyes SHIFT, see Bellatrix racing forward through the reeds, then SHIFT back as the veil of smoke evaporates, reveals... Greyback. Bellatrix makes an ODD, CLICKING noise -- like a signal -- and Greyback edges forward, sweeping away the reeds in front of him and revealing... ... Harry as he pelts forward.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: No, Harry! It's a trap! Harry falters, looking toward Ginny’s voice and spies Greyback. Bellatrix stops dead, wheels in her tracks and, seeing Ginny, SHRIEKS with RAGE. Raising her wand, she fires a BOLT of RED LIGHT which explodes in a SHOWER of SPARKS around Ginny. Ginny fires back, then wheels away, flashing through the reeds and coming face to face with... Greyback, sharp teeth glittering.

dialogues.speaker: GREYBACK
dialogues.text: Don’t you smell clean. Just then, a BOLT OF BLUE bursts off Greyback’s back and he turns, sees Harry standing several yards off. As Greyback gives chase, Ginny pelts after and we CUT BACK AND FORTH BETWEEN Harry, Ginny and the beast between them, faster and faster, their BREATHS shortening until... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 85 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 84.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Greyback rushes into a clearing, panting, glancing about. Just then, TWIN BOLTS of light blast from opposite sides of the clearing and Greyback is lifted in the air, slammed to the ground. As he regains his feet he looks into the reeds and sees Harry and Ginny, wands poised. He grins... when Bellatrix’s odd, CLICKING signal carries through the night once again. Turning away, he exits. Harry and Ginny slowly step out of the reeds, stare at each other wordlessly. Then... Ron, Fred, George, Arthur and Lupin come thrashing into the clearing, stop. All around them, the reeds SMOKE, the flames dying. Across the marsh, Bellatrix’s cackle rises briefly on the air -- then all is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You're lucky you weren’t killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione reads the Daily Prophet as she walks alongside Harry. The HEADLINE is GLOOMY: “MORE DISAPPEARANCES.”

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You have to realize who you are, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (sharply) I know who I am, Hermione, alright? (frowning) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: So tell me what Arthur said.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: If Dumbledore’s traveling places, it’s news to the Ministry. But get this: that night at Borgin & Burkes? It seems Draco was looking at a Vanishing Cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What would Draco want with a Vanishing Cabinet?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You tell me. Hermione frowns, pondering this. Then: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 84a.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: He looks different, don’t you think? Draco. Almost... ill.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Who could tell the difference? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 86 87 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 85.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Lav, c’mon. Of course I’1l wear it. They glance ahead, see Ron and a pouting Lavender. Ron holds a GOLD CHAIN which spells out “My Sweetheart.”

dialogues.speaker: LAVENDER BROWN
dialogues.text: That’s my Won-Won.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I have to go vomit. As Hermione exits, Harry spies Ginny, in an alcove, sitting by as Dean laughs with SEAMUS. Looking up, she sees Harry, gives a feeble wave. He waves back and we --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DUMBLEDORE’S OFFICE - NIGHT 86 HARRY’S FACE PLUNGING INTO WATER, BREAKING THE SURFACE... FLASHBACK - INT. SLUGHORN’S OFFICE - NIGHT (YEARS PAST) 8 We emerge from the CRACKLING EMBERS of a FIREPLACE. A much younger -- and more smartly dressed Slughorn probes a dish of CRYSTALLIZED PINEAPPLE as he holds court before 16-YEAR-OLD TOM RIDDLE and five other BOYS. The CRYSTAL HOURGLASS sits on a side table.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Sir, is it true that Professor Merrythought is retiring? Slughorn chuckles, wags a sugar-encrusted finger at Riddle.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Now, Tom, I couldn’t tell you if I knew, could I? I must say, m’boy, I’d like to know where you get your information. More knowledgeable than half the staff, you are. (as the other boys laugh) By the way, thank you for the pineapple -- you’re quite right, it is my favorite -- how is it you knew? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 86.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Intuition. Riddle smiles but his expression suggests intuition had nothing to do with it. Slughorn chuckles uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Good gracious, look at the time. Off you go, boys, or Professor Dippett will have us all in detention. Lestrange, Avery, don’t forget your essays... As the others file out, Slughorn busies himself with some papers when -- Ping! -- he turns, finds Riddle still there, standing by the crystal hourglass.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Look sharp, Tom. You don’t want to be caught out of bed after hours...

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: I know a secret shortcut or two.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Yes, I imagine you do. Something on your mind, Tom?

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I couldn’t think of anyone else to go to. The other professors, well, they’re not like you. They might... misunderstand.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Go on. Riddle slips off the RING on his left hand, begins to roll it between his fingers. It is set with a BLACK STONE.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: I was in the library the other night, in the Restricted section, and I read something rather odd, about a bit of rare magic, and I thought perhaps you could illuminate me... Suddenly, a DENSE FOG engulfs the room and SLUGHORN’S VOICE twists into an ANGRY SHRIEK: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 88 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 87.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: I don't know anything about such things and I wouldn't tell you if I did! Now get out of here at once and don't ever let me catch you mentioning it again! The FOG grows thicker and... INT. DUMBLEDORE’S OFFICE - NIGHT (PRESENT) 88 «+. CAMERA EMERGES FROM the swirling Pensieve. Harry blinks, finds Dumbledore studying him from across the room.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Confused? I would be surprised if you weren’t.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t understand -- what happened?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: This is perhaps the most important memory I’ve collected. It’s also a lie. (off Harry's look) This memory has been tampered with. In this case by the person whose memory it is, our friend Professor Slughorn.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But why would he tamper with his own memory?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I suspect he is ashamed of it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Why indeed. Dumbledore trails his withered fingers in the Pensieve.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I asked you to get to know Professor Slughorn and you’ve done so. (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 89 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 88.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now I want you to persuade him to divulge his true memory. Any way you can.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t know him that well, sir --

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: You’re the Chosen One, Harry. And Horace is, at heart, a decent man. Provide the proper circumstances and he will confess his sins. Dumbledore lifts his fingers from the Pensieve, studies them. They are, in this moment, iridescent, whole.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: This memory is everything, Harry. Without it, we are blind. Without it, we leave the fate of our world to chance. You have no choice. You must not fail. As Harry watches, the damp sheen enveloping Dumbledore’s hand evaporates and once again his fingers decay. INT./EXT. SLUGHORN’S CLASSROOM - DAY 89 As the CLASS BELL RINGS, a group of FIRST YEARS rise.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Now don’t forget to look over the chapter on antidotes. I’1l be poisoning one of you next time we meet. I'm joking! Off you go! Don’t forget your rattails, Miss Alys. As the tiny ones scurry out, Harry is revealed, waiting just outside the door. He enters. For a moment, Slughorn merely HUMS over his briefcase, unaware. Then...

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Ah! If it isn’t the Prince of Potions himself! To what do I owe the pleasure?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, sir, I wondered if I might ask you something.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Ask away, my dear boy, ask away! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 89.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, you see, the other day I was in the Restricted Section -- in the library -- and I stumbled upon something rather odd while reading. Something about a bit of rare magic...

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Yes? And exactly what was this rare magic.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’m not sure... That is, I don’t recall the name... exactly. But it got me wondering... Are there some kinds of magic you’re not allowed to teach? Slughorn looks up, eyes Harry carefully.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: I’m a Potions Professor, Harry. Perhaps your question would best be posed to Professor Snape.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes, well, we don’t exactly see eye-to-eye, sir. What I mean to say is, he’s not like you. He might... misunderstand. Recognition flickers in Slughorn’s eyes. A glint of fear.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: There can be no light without the dark. And so it is with magic. Myself, I have always strived to live within the light. I suggest you do the same. Slughorn gathers his briefcase, starts to exit.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Did you say the same to Tom Riddle, sir? When he came asking questions. Slughorn freezes in the doorway, then slowly turns.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Dumbledore put you up to this. Didn’t he? Didn’t he! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 90 91 92 93 94 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 90.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sir -- Slughorn silences him with an upraised hand. Then, without another word, he is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning flashes. Thunder rumbles. Rain lashes the windows. Through the birdcage’s grid of wires someone approaches. We RACK FOCUS... FIND Harry. As he passes, we HOLD ON the cage. One bird is missing. Only the BLACK one remains. As thunder BOOMS, the bird RUFFLES its feathers. Harry glances down the corridor adjacent, sees a FIGURE start up the far stairwell. As the SHADOW ASCENDS, Harry follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIGURE continues on, passes OUT OF VIEW. Harry follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, still trailing. The FIGURE turns a corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .».. comes INTO VIEW. It’s Draco. He stops halfway down, looks back the way he came. HARRY’S SHADOW scales the wall as he approaches. Draco watches calmly, then turns, CLOSES HIS EYES. And simply... DISAPPEARS. Harry turns the corner. Stops. No one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Draco wends his way through the towering shelves, removes the tapestry and faces the gleaming cabinet. He reaches into his coat and carefully removes the WHITE BIRD. Holding it in one hand, he studies it, gently stroking its feathers with the other. For a moment, he seems lost in the activity, lost in the bird’s coal black eyes, its bobbing head. Then, gently, he places it in the cabinet and closes the door. Waits. When he opens the cabinet, the bird is gone. He closes the cabinet once more. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 94 95 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 91.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A feather, white and gleaming, clings to the cuff of his jacket. He takes it, turns it in the light. It is fragile, translucent. He looks briefly lost again, then blinks, turns back to the cabinet, slowly reaches out and opens it. The bird is there. Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione does her homework while Harry peers at the Marauder’s Map. They are the only ones present.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Did you actually expect you could just walk up to Ol’ Sluggy and ask him to reveal his deepest, darkest secret? Honestly, Harry, sometimes I think the Daily Prophet should call you the Dim One.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (rising to go) You're going to have to persuade him somehow. And now, I’m afraid, you’ve made it a lot harder.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hermione. I think Malfoy’s leaving the castle. Hermione stops dead, looks back at Harry. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’ve seen it. Sometimes... sometimes he just disappears off the Map.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: That's... not possible. No one can leave the castle these days. The Map is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The Map is never wrong. Hermione frowns, thinking, then shakes her head, turns away.  96 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 92. INT. BOYS’ DORMITORY (GRYFFINDOR TOWER) - NIGHT (LATER) 9 Harry slumps into the darkened dormitory. Stops. On the floor, glittering in the moonlight, is a trail of CANDY FOILS. A bit further along, Ron sits in his PJ’s upon the window sill, a HEART-SHAPED BOX by his side.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It's beautiful, isn’t it? The moon.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Divine. Had ourselves a little late-night snack, did we?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It was on your bed. The box. Thought I’d try one...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Or twenty.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I can’t stop thinking about her, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Really? Honestly, I reckoned she was starting to annoy you.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: She could never annoy me. I think... I think I love her.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Ron nods. Harry looks bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well... Brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Do you think she knows I exist?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Bloody well hope so. She’s been snogging you for three months.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Snogging? Who’re you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Who’re you talking about? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 93.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Romilda, of course. Romilda Vane. Harry stares at Ron... then grins.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Okay. Very funny. He turns to his bed, throws back the covers when... the heart-shaped box caroms off his head.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What the hell was that for?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It’s no joke! I’m in love with her!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Okay! Fine! You’re in love with her! Have you ever actually met her!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No. Can you introduce me? Harry stops rubbing his head, eyes Ron oddly, then glances at the candy box at his feet. There is an envelope. Taking it, he slides out a card: “Dear Harry. Thinking sweet thoughts of you. Happy Valentine’s Day. Romilda.” He suppresses a smile.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ron, these chocolates, they’re -- C’mon. I’m going to introduce you to Romilda Vane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry leads Ron, still in his PJs, toward a door.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Devastatingly handsome. Harry RAPS on the door. FOOTSTEPS -- followed by a LOUD CRASH.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Damn it all! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 97 98 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 94,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The door OPENS. Slughorn stands in a GREEN VELVET DRESSING GOWN and matching NIGHTCAP, looking bleary-eyed and annoyed. Something SMOKES on the floor behind him -- the FLOOR LAMP he’d sent wobbling the night of the dinner party.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Yes???lil! (warily) Oh. Potter. It’s you. I’m afraid I’m busy at the moment -- He starts to close the door. Harry sticks his foot in.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sir. I’m sorry. I wouldn’t bother you if it weren’t absolutely --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Where’s Romilda? Slughorn squints over Harry’s shoulder at Ron who is doing precisely the same from the other side.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: What’s the matter with Wenby? Harry leans forward, WHISPERS into Slughorn’s ear. He frowns.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Ah. Very well. Bring him in. INT. SLUGHORN’S OFFICE - NIGHT (MOMENTS LATER) 98 Slughorn, with practiced ease, mixes a concoction of powders and potions into a goblet while Ron peers into a mirror. As he paces, Harry passes “the shelf” and finds, front and center, a PHOTOGRAPH of himself and Slughorn -- the one taken at the Christmas party. In deep b.g. is photograph of Snape, as a young student, clutching his POTIONS TEXTBOOK.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: I’d have thought you could whip up a remedy for this in no time, Harry -- an expert potioneer like you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I figured this called for a more practiced hand, sir. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 98 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 95.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hello, darling. Fancy a drink? Slughorn and Harry turn, watch Ron WINK into the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Hm. Perhaps you’re right. As Slughorn goes back to mixing, Harry eyes him furtively.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, sir. About the other day. Our... misunderstanding. Slughorn eyes Harry briefly, looks away.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Yes, well, water under the bridge as they say, correct?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I mean, I’m sure you're tired of it, after all these years. The questions. About... Voldemort. Slughorn’s mixing hand falters instantly.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: I’ll ask you not to use that name. Slughorn’s stare is fierce. Finally, he turns, goblet in hand, and puts a smile on his face, his voice cheery.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. It’s just, well, Dumbledore once said that fear of a name only increases fear of the thing itself. It seemed sensible.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: With all due respect, Dumbledore sometimes forgets that most of us do not possess powers so great that we can risk offending the most dangerous Dark Lord who ever lived. Slughorn’s stare is fierce, as fierce as the one Dumbledore fixed Harry with. Finally, he turns away.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Alright, m’boy! Bottoms up! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 95a.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What’s this? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 96.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: A tonic for the nerves. Ron drinks. Beams briefly. Then his grin sags.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What happened to me?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Love potion.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: And a bloody strong one at that.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I feel really... bad.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Pick-me-up’s what you need, m’boy. (eying Harry again) Do us all good, I think. I’ve got butterbeer, wine -- ah -- and a dazzling oak-matured mead. I had other intentions for this but given the circumstances... Slughorn takes a STOUT BOTTLE and fills a glass for Ron. As Ron SIPS, Slughorn fills a pair for he and Harry.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: There we are, Potter. To life! CRASH! -- Ron’s glass hits the floor and he crumples to his knees, then tumbles full out on the rug, SPASMING horribly, FOAM oozing over his lips. Harry rushes to him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ron! Ron!!! Professor, help him!

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: I d-don’t understand --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Professor! Do something!! Slughorn shuffles haplessly through his bag, MUMBLING, at a loss. Harry turns back to Ron -- his skin is turning BLUE.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: He’s choking!! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 98 99 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 97.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry glances about, then leaps up, and frantically begins to strip the walls of its potion stores, looking for something, anything. A box tumbles, something spills: a scattering of stones, no bigger than a robin’s egg, shriveled and dry. Snatching one, he wrenches open Ron’s jaw and THRUSTS it deep into his THROAT. Instantly Ron stops moving, paralyzed. The room is suddenly silent. He’s not breathing. Harry places both hands behind Ron’s head and gives it a SHAKE. Another.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Breathe! C’mon, Ron, don’t be a prat. Breathe! BREATHE! Harry shakes him again and again... then stops. Ron’s head rolls limply from his fingers. Slughorn looks on, mouth agape. Useless. Then... A COUGH, a great hiccupping COUGH -- like a swimmer almost drowned -- and Ron is back. Breathing.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: These girls are gonna kill me, Harry. Harry grins. Then Ron’s eyes flutter. Out. But breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Dumbledore, Snape, McGonagall, Ginny and a very somber Hermione circle Ron’s bed as MADAM POMFREY ministers to him. Slughorn sits off to the side, ina chair, looking stunned.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Quick thinking on your part, Harry. Using a Bezoar. You must be very proud of your student, eh, Horace?

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Hm? Oh. Yes... very proud. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL I think we all agree that Mr. Potter’s actions were heroic. The question is: Why were they necessary.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Why indeed. Dumbledore takes the half-empty bottle of mead, still bearing a bit of GIFTWRAP. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 98.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Just then 99

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: This appears to be a gift, Horace. You don’t by chance remember who gave you this bottle, do you -- which by the way possesses remarkably subtle hints of licorice and cherry when not polluted with poison.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Actually I had intended to give it as a gift myself.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: To whom might I ask?

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: You, Headmaster. -- the DOOR BURSTS OPEN: Lavender Brown.

dialogues.speaker: LAVENDER BROWN
dialogues.text: Where is he? Where’s my Won-Won! Has he been asking for me? (stopping; glaring daggers) What’s she doing here?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I might ask you the same.

dialogues.speaker: LAVENDER BROWN
dialogues.text: I happen to be his girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I happen to be his... friend.

dialogues.speaker: LAVENDER BROWN
dialogues.text: Don’t make me laugh. You haven’t spoken in weeks. I suppose you want to make up with him now that he’s suddenly all interesting.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: He’s been poisoned, you daft dimbo! And for the record, I’ve always found him interesting. Hermione frowns, a bit embarrassed. Ron SNORTS, stirring.

dialogues.speaker: LAVENDER BROWN
dialogues.text: Ha! See? He senses my presence. I’m here, Won-Won. I’m here -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 99 100 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 99.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Er... My... Nee... Er! My! Nee! Ron, in a haze, reaches out blindly. Blushing, Hermione takes his hand. Instantly, he falls unconscious again. Lavender, vibrating with rage, stalks out. Dumbledore beams.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Ah, to be young and feel love's keen sting. Come, everyone, I think Mr. Weasley is well tended. As Dumbledore leads the others past Harry, Harry studies him. Ginny passes, face very close, WHISPERING as she indicates Ron and Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: ‘Bout time, don’t you think? Harry watches her go, hopelessly smitten, sees that Slughorn has paused in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: I’ve always cherished my students. They're my life... Then he is gone too. Harry turns back, studies Hermione, hand enfolded over Ron’s. She looks up, sees his faint smile.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Oh shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry spoons soup into his mouth while perusing the Half- Blood Prince’s Potion book, his eyes lingering, as before, over the SECTUMSEMPRA SPELL: “For Enemies.” Ron absently twirls his wand as he covertly eyes Lavender. Hermione frowns over the Prophet when... a snowflake falls upon her nose.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Ron. Stop. You’re making it snow.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Huh? Ron looks up, sees that it is SNOWING exclusively over the trio. Hermione places her hand atop his wand and he blinks, as if the gesture kindles some sense-memory. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 100.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Tell me again how I broke up with Lavender? Harry pauses on his soup, exchanges a glance with Hermione, who carefully withdraws her hand from Ron's.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Um, well, she came to visit you in the hospital, you see, and you talked -- I don’t believe it was a long conversation --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Don’t get me wrong. I’m bloody thrilled to be shot of her. It’s just she seems... a bit put out. As one, the three glance over at Lavender and are rewarded with a lethal squint.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Does, doesn’t she? And you say you don’t remember a thing from that night? Not one thing?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Well... there is... something. (as Hermione hangs) But no. It can’t be. Besides, I was completely boggled, wasn’t I?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Right. Boggled... Hermione slumps back, frowning. Harry smiles with amusement. Just then, a MILD COMMOTION draws his attention. At the back of the Hall, a group of girls surrounds a new arrival.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
