dialogues.text: That’s Katie. That’s Katie Bell. Katie Bell, pale but smiling, greets the other girls. After a moment, she looks up. Finds Harry standing before her.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How are you, Katie?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE BELL
dialogues.text: Give me a moment, girls. The girls drift off. Harry watches them go, curious, then: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 101 102 103 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 101.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE BELL
dialogues.text: I know you’re going to ask, Harry. But I don’t know who cursed me. I’ve tried to remember. Honestly. But I just... can’t... Katie’s eyes shift. She goes ashen. Harry turns, follows her gaze and finds... Malfoy, staring at her. Katie backs away, retreating to the other girls. Harry watches her go, then looks back. Catches Malfoy fleeing the Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malfoy hurtles past, forehead gleaming with sweat, passes OUT OF FRAME. Seconds later, Harry appears, follows. As he passes the birdcage... we HOLD. It’s now EMPTY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malfoy lurches to the mirror, steadies himself against the sink. Then, with a great, heaving shudder begins to... CRY. In the MIRROR, we see the bathroom DOOR ease open: Harry. He stops, stunned. Malfoy’s eyes shift. Horrified to be exposed. He wheels, points his wand. WHOOSH! The LAMP next to Harry’s head SHATTERS. FLAMES spider up the ceiling. Harry draws his own wand, fires back. The CISTERN behind Malfoy EXPLODES and WATER sweeps the ceiling, rains down. Malfoy HOWLS with RAGE. Harry readies himself.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: Cruci--

dialogues.speaker: SECTUMSEMPRA
dialogues.text: BLOOD SPURTS from Malfoy’s face and SCARLET SLASHES OOZE through the white of his shirt. He staggers, HOWLS again and COLLAPSES. Harry glares at his wand in horror, then slushes across the floor, the water running red with Malfoy’s blood. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 103 104 105 106 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 102.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: Don't touch me! Don't you dare touch me! Harry stops dead... transfixed by a FLASH of SOMETHING DARK pushing through the wet fabric of Malfoy’s shirtsleeve. Just then... Snape BURSTS THROUGH THE DOOR. Seeing Malfoy -- and the nature of his injuries -- he eyes Harry with keen curiosity. Kneeling, he traces the TIP of his WAND over Malfoy’s wounds, MURMURING an EERIE INCANTATION. Instantly, the skin begins to knit itself together. Harry backs away, Snape’s ancient CHANT ringing in his ears, blood floating like crimson flowers on the floor, backing away until he reaches the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sits numbly, the Potions textbook lying limp in his hand. Hermione, Ron and Ginny sit together, a bit apart, keeping a kind of vigil. Finally, Ginny rises, steps to him.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: You have to get rid of it. Today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Potions book in hand, follows Ginny past the empty birdcage and down the corridor when she pauses, turns to the wall and shuts her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Take my hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginny and Harry materialize.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The Room of Requirement... Ginny nods, turns away. Harry follows.

dialogues.speaker: SECONDS LATER
dialogues.text: Harry eyes the shelves that tower above him and the odd things they hold: a SMALL CAGE bearing the SKELETON of some long-dead creature. A JAR of QUIVERING EYEBALLS which track him as he passes. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 103.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Over the years, if someone had a secret, if they wanted to conceal something, this is where they came. Some of these things are almost as old as the castle itself.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Who showed you this? First.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Fred and George. First year. I hid Tom Riddle’s diary here for a time. Wish I’d left it... As Ginny drifts in the memory, Harry studies her, then a SCUFFLING SOUND is heard nearby. They turn, look off.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY /HARRY
dialogues.text: (at the same time) What was that? They turn back, look at each other. Ginny smiles. Then:

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND VANISHING CABINET
dialogues.text: Harry and Ginny approach. The SCUFFLING GROWS LOUDER. Harry reaches out, pulls aside the tapestry. Reacts. The cabinet door VIBRATES. Slowly, he opens it and... +... the BLACK BIRD flies free in a rush of FLAPPING wings.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: See, you never know what you’1l find up here. Harry nods, looks back to the cabinet, mystified.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: All right. Close your eyes. That way you can’t be tempted. Ginny slips the book from his fingers and starts to back away. She mouths: Close... your... eyes. As she leaves FRAME, CAMERA PUSHES EVER-SO-SLOWLY IN ON Harry. Still. Waiting. For a long moment, there is only silence. Then a shadow gently eclipses Harry's face.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: There’s something else. Another secret of sorts. One of mine... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 104.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ginny leans in then and places her mouth on Harry’s.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: That can stay hidden up here too, if you like. Harry opens his eyes, watches Ginny back away, then disappear around the corner. He stares at the empty air, blinking, then watches the black bird flutter overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, looking a tad dazed, walks aimlessly.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So. Did you and Ginny do it? Harry jumps, watches Ron appear.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You know. Hide the book.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. Just then, Slughorn rounds the far end of the corridor and -- spying Harry -- does a little Oliver Hardy “Oops” and retreats.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Still no luck with Slughorn, I take it? Harry shakes his head -- then stops cold, stares at the empty space where Slughorn stood moments before.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Say that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tiny VIAL of FELIX FELICIS glimmers in Harry’s palm as he and Ron and Hermione huddle in the empty dormitory. They exchange glances, then Harry brings the vial to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Well? How do you feel? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 108 109 110 111 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 105.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Excellent. Really excellent.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Now remember. Slughorn usually eats early, takes a short walk and then returns to his office.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Right. I’m going down to Hagrid’s.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What? No, Harry -- you've got to go see Slughorn. We have a plan --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. I’ve got a good feeling about going to Hagrid’s. I feel like it’s the place to be tonight, know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE/RON
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Trust me. I know what I’m doing. Or at least Felix does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BOY with a PREFECT’S BADGE patrols the corridor. Bored, he ponders the progress of his FAINT MUSTACHE in a mirror. Harry walks by, unseen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filch paces, standing guard while Mrs. Norris sits calmly by. A MOUSE appears in the OPEN helmet of a SUIT OF ARMOR, washes its face with its tiny paws, then spies Mrs. Norris -- who HISSES. The mouse makes a quick retreat and the FACE PLATE comes CLANGING down. As Filch wheels, Harry strolls past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO AURORS, twin SILHOUETTES, patrol the grounds. Harry approaches, about to intersect their paths when, at the last second, something on the ground catches his eye. He KNEELS, considers a BEETLE on its back, legs churning helplessly. Harry extends his finger, letting the tiny bug gain purchase, then tips it upright... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 105A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: .+.jJust as the Aurors’ SHADOWS quiver over him and vanish. Rising, Harry starts off in one direction, then stops, as if compelled by some inner voice, and heads the opposite way.  HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry HUMS placidly. Up ahead, a FIGURE ripples beyond the steamy panes of the Greenhouse. It’s Slughorn, hunched over a PLANT whose TENDRILS coil eerily, resisting his attentions. Snip! He stealthily removes a sprig, looks up and JUMPS.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Merlin’s beard, Harry!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir. I should’ve announced myself. Cleared my throat. Coughed. You probably feared I was Madam Sprout.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Well, yes, actually -- (paranoid) Why would you think that?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Just the general behavior, sir. The sneaking around. The jumping when you saw me. By the way, those Tentacula leaves -- they’re quite valuable, aren’t they?

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Ten galleons a leaf to the right buyer -- not that I’m familiar with such back alley transactions. One hears rumors is all. My own interests are purely academic, of course.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Personally, these plants have always kind of freaked me out. Harry gives a little SHIVER of the shoulders, smiles. Slughorn cocks his head, studies him oddly.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Exactly how did you get out of the castle, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Through the front doors, sir. I’m off to Hagrid’s, you see. He’s a very dear friend and I felt like paying him a visit. So if you don’t mind, I’1l be going. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 107.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Harry!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: It’s nearly nightfall. Surely you realize I can’t allow you to roam the grounds all by yourself.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, then by all means come along, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry appears over a rise, strolling happily along... when Slughorn appears, huffing and puffing to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Harry, I must insist you accompany me back to the castle immediately!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That would be counterproductive, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: And what makes you say that?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No idea. Slughorn frowns impatiently -- then stops, blinks.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Merlin’s beard... Up ahead, Hagrid sits disconsolately upon a stump. Nearby, Aragog’s massive body lies legs up.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Is that an actual Acromantula?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: A dead one, I think, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SECONDS LATER
dialogues.text: Harry and Slughorn approach a sullen Hagrid. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 113 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 108.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: ‘Arry. ‘Orace.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: My god, dear man. How did you ever manage to kill it?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Kill ‘im! Me oldest friend, ‘e was!

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I... (didn’t realize.) Slughorn falters helplessly. Hagrid waves his hand.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Ah, don’ worry yerself. Yer not alone. Seriously misunderstood creatures -- spiders. It’s the eyes, I reckon. Unnerve people.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Not to mention the pincers. Harry makes a little claw motion with his hand, while making a CLICKING sound. Hagrid eyes Harry curiously.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: I reckon that too... How’d yeh get outta the castle anyways?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Through the front doors.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Hagrid. I wouldn’t want to be indelicate, but Acromantula venom is uncommonly rare and, well, if you wouldn’t mind my extracting a vial or two -- purely for academic pursuits...

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Don’ suppose it’s doin’ ‘im any good, izzit?

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: My thoughts exactly! Always carry a few spare ampoules for just such occasions. Old Potion Master’s habit, you know... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 108A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Slughorn rummages about his pockets, extracts some SMALL VIALS -- all empty save for one containing a HAIRY WORM - then scrambles up close to Aragog. Harry and Hagrid watch.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Wish yeh coulda seen ‘im in ‘is prime. Magnificent ‘e was. Jus’ magnificent... Hagrid BLINKS wildly, then takes out a handkerchief and SNORTS LOUDLY into it. Slughorn looks up, studies Hagrid’s sorry expression with empathy and steps away.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Why don’t I say a few words? I trust he had family?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: (clearing his throat) Farewell... Slughorn frowns.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Aragog.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: (a nod) Farewell, Aragog, king of arachnids. Though your body will decay, your spirit lingers on in the quiet, web-spun places of your Forest home. May your many-eyed descendents ever flourish and your human friends find solace for the loss they have sustained.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Tha’ was... tha’ was... beautiful. Hagrid wipes his eyes, then rises. He walks to Aragog, studies him lovingly, then puts a shoulder to the big beast’s body... and sends him tumbling into the freshly- dug grave adjacent with a SICKENING THUNK.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID/SLUGHORN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (singing) And Odo the hero, they bore him back home...  114 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 109. INT. HAGRID’S HUT - NIGHT (HOURS LATER) 114 Harry, Hagrid and Slughorn sit at the massive kitchen table, which is strewn with EMPTY WINE BOTTLES. Hagrid and Slughorn are feeling no pain, while Harry looks clear eyed, focused.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID/SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: To the place he'd known as a lad, They laid him to rest with his hat inside out and his wand snapped in two, which was sad... As they finish, both men CHUCKLE. Hagrid tops off everyone’s mug with a bit more wine. Harry brings his mug to his lap... then slyly pours it into the bucket at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: I had ‘im from an egg, yeh know. Tiny little thing he was when he hatched. No bigger’n a Pekinese.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Sweet. I once had a fish. Francis. Lovely little thing. One day I came downstairs and he’d vanished. Poof.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Tha’s odd.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Isn’t it? That’s life, I suppose. One goes along and then... poof.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Poof.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Poof. They all nod soberly. Slughorn’s eyes rise to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: That’s never unicorn hair, Hagrid? Hagrid looks up, reels a bit. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: But my dear chap, do you know how much that’s worth? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 110.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: No idea... no idea at all... Thunk! Hagrid’s great shaggy head hits the table. Instantly, he is SNORING, so DEEPLY his MUG shimmies across the table. Slughorn smiles, regards Harry, who merely stares back. Slughorn averts his eyes. Suddenly nervous. A WIND rises outside. Windowpanes rattle.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: It was a student who gave me Francis. One spring afternoon I discovered a bowl upon my desk with a few inches of clear water. There was a flower petal floating upon the surface. As I watched, the petal sank, but just before it touched bottom... it transformed. Into a wee fish. It was beautiful magic, wondrous to behold. The petal had come from a lily. Hearing “lily,” Harry looks up. Slughorn nods.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Your mother. The day I came downstairs, the day I found the bowl empty... was the day she... Slughorn falters, pain etching his face.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: I know what you want. But I can’t give it to you. It will ruin me... Harry studies Slughorn a moment, thinking, then speaks.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Do you know why I survived? The night I got this. Slughorn looks up, sees Harry pointing to his scar.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Because of her. Because she sacrificed herself. Because she refused to step aside. Because her love was more powerful than Voldemort.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Please don’t say his -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 114 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 111.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’m not afraid of the name, Professor. And I’m not afraid of him. And you shouldn’t be either. She didn’t just die for me that night. She died for you too. She died for everyone who’s ever woken in the middle of the night afraid a Death Eater waited on their doorstep. Slughorn gazes into the guttering candle before him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Professor. I’m going to tell you something, something others have only guessed at. It’s true. I am the Chosen One. Slughorn looks up. Harry nods. Slughorn’s

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Only I can kill him. But in order to do so, I need to know what Tom Riddle asked you that night in your office all those years ago. And I need to know what you told him. eyes well with tears, his hands tremble.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Be brave, Professor. Be brave like my mother. Otherwise you disgrace her. Otherwise she died for nothing. Otherwise, the bowl remains empty forever. Slughorn shakes his head, staring into the candle. Finally, s lowly, he removes his wand.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Don’t think too badly of me once you’ve seen it. You don’t know what he was like... even then. Slughorn fishes out a tiny vial -- the one with the WORM -- but his hand is shaking so violently, Harry has to take it. Slowly, Slughorn raises his wand, touches it to his temple and withdraws a LONG, SILVER THREAD. Harry extends the vial and... it drops within.  115 116 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 112. INT. DUMBLEDORE’S OFFICE - NIGHT 115 Dumbledore holds the vial in wonderment. The worm hangs in eerie suspension.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: How is he? Horace? Harry shrugs. Dumbledore nods, then tips his hand. A LONG strand hangs suspended like glass. A pearl forms... and as it hangs... Harry’s eyes shift, notice a DRAWING on Dumbledore’s desk, one of Tom Riddle’s drawings seen at the orphanage, of the CAVE and the distinct OUTCROPPING. Then... the pearl drops. FLASHBACK - INT. SLUGHORN’S OFFICE - NIGHT (YEARS PAST) 1 As before. The CRACKLING EMBERS of the FIRE. Slughorn, a circle of six. Riddle commanding the room.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Sir, is it true that Professor Merrythought is retiring? Slughorn chuckles, wags a sugar-encrusted finger at Riddle.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Now, Tom, I couldn’t tell you if I knew, could I? I must say, m’boy, I’d like to know where you get your information. More knowledgable than half the staff, you are. (as the other boys laugh) By the way, thank you for the pineapple -- you’re quite right, it is my favorite -- how is it you knew?

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Intuition.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: (an uneasy chuckle) Good gracious, is it that time already? Off you go, boys, or Professor Dippett will have us all in detention. Lestrange, Avery, don’t forget your essays... The others exit, when -- PING! -- Slughorn turns, eyes the hourglass, finds Tom Riddle still there. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 113.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Look sharp, Tom. You don’t want to be caught out of bed after hours...

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: I know a secret shortcut or two.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Yes, I imagine you do. Something on your mind, Tom?

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I couldn’t think of anyone else to go to. The other Professors, well, they’re not like you. They might... misunderstand.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: I was in the library the other night, in the Restricted section, and I read something rather odd, about a bit of rare magic and I thought perhaps you could illuminate me. It’s called, as I understand it... a Horcrux. Slughorn’s weak smile evaporates altogether.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Horcrux. I came across the term while reading and I didn’t fully understand it.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: I’m not sure what you were reading, Tom, but that’s very Dark stuff, very Dark indeed.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Which is why I came to you. I mean no disrespect to the rest of the staff, but I thought if anyone could tell me... it would be you. Slughorn frowns, clearly disturbed, then speaks quietly. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 114.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: A Horcrux is an object in which a person has concealed part of their soul.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Yes, I thought it might be something like that. But I don’t understand how that works, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: One splits one’s soul and hides part of it in an object. By doing so, you are protected should you be attacked and your body destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Protected?

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: That part of your soul that was hidden, lives on. In other words, you cannot die. Riddle nods and TURNS AWAY, staring at himself in the MIRROR on the wall opposite. A hint of RED glints in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: How does one split his soul, sir?

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: I think you can guess the answer to that, Tom.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Murder.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Yes. Killing rips the soul apart. It is a violation against nature. After, one is never the same.

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Out of curiosity, sir -- can you only split your soul once? For instance, isn’t seven the most powerfully magical number --

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN
dialogues.text: Seven! Merlin’s beard, Tom! Isn’t it bad enough to think of killing one person? To rip the soul into seven pieces... (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 116 117 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 115.

dialogues.speaker: SLUGHORN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (stopping; worried) This is all hypothetical, isn’t it, Tom? All academic...

dialogues.speaker: TOM RIDDLE
dialogues.text: Of course, sir. And I promise I’1ll not speak of our conversation. It’1ll be our little secret... Riddle reaches out then and pinches the FLAME of a candle, killing it. As SMOKE RISES, we --

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE INTO
dialogues.text: INT. DUMBLEDORE’S OFFICE - SAME TIME - NIGHT (PRESENT) 11 «+. the surface of the Pensieve, where Riddle quivers. We RACK FOCUS and Dumbledore’s troubled face bleeds through Riddle’s.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sir -- Dumbledore holds up his withered hand, silencing him, turns away. Harry studies him, waiting, the hush palpable.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: (haunted) This is beyond anything I imagined. In my life I have seen things that are unimaginably horrific. I know now... you will see worse. Dumbledore looks off, his eyes distant. Harry watches him intently, as do the HEADMASTERS in their frames above. Finally, tentatively, Harry speaks.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Do you mean to say he succeeded, sir? In making a Horcrux?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Oh he succeeded. And not just once. Think, Harry. He’s just told us.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Seven. He made seven -- the most powerfully magical number. But... what are they exactly? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: They can be anything. The most commonplace of objects. A ring, for example. Or a book... 116. 117 Dumbledore slides open a drawer, removes the RING and Tom Riddle’s battered DIARY.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Tom Riddle’s diary --

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: It’s a Horcrux, yes. Four years ago, when you saved Ginny Weasley’s life in the Chamber of Secrets, when you brought me this -- (holding up the diary) I knew. This was a different kind of magic. Very dark. Very powerful. But until tonight, I had no idea just how powerful...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And the ring...?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Belonged to Voldemort’s mother. It was difficult to find and... (raising his damaged hand) ++. even more difficult to destroy.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But if you could find them all. If you did destroy each Horcrux...

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: One destroys Voldemort. Harry begins to reach out for the ring...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But how would you find them? They could be hidden anywhere, couldn't they...

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: True. But magic, especially Dark magic... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 117.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Just then, as the flash of Harry’s fingers make contact with the ring, IMAGES FLASH by in DIZZYING succession: VOLDEMORT’S FACE, twisted in pain. A DERELICT HOUSE, deep in a haunted clearing. An ANCIENT CUP, gleaming as it tumbles from an old woman’s hand. A SNAKE (NAGINI) slithering through damp grass. Dumbledore slipping the ring onto his finger, recoiling as his skin decays...

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: ... leaves traces. Harry’s clenched hand SPASMS, RELEASES. The ring skitters across Dumbledore’s desk and Harry brings a hand to his chest, a look of bewilderment on his face. Dumbledore watches the ring spin down, then glances at Harry and slowly extends his own hand, lightly touching the center of Harry’s chest with the tips of ashen fingers, as if reading braille, as if he can somehow “see” into Harry’s heart. Trepidation -- and recognition -- flicker over his face.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s where you’ve been going, isn’t it, sir? When you leave the school. Harry’s eyes drift once again to the postcard on the desk. Dumbledore withdraws his hand, nodding, still studying Harry oddly, his voice, when it comes, distant.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Yes. And I think... perhaps... I may have found another. But this time I cannot hope to destroy it alone. Harry peers into Dumbledore’s eyes. Dumbledore nods.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Once again, I shall ask too much of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry stands at a window, looking out. He brings his fingers to his chest again when... Hermione comes up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry. It’s time.  HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Hermione and Ron walk.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hermione, is the Room of Requirement unplottable?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: If one wants it to be. Why?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It would explain why I thought Malfoy was leaving the castle when he disappeared off the Map.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: He was going to the Room of Requirement.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Of course, and that explains the Vanishing Cabinet as well!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No. I got an owl from Dad this morning. The one at Borgin & Burke’s? It’s still there.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But I’m telling you. I saw it -- Just then, the twins appear, pass. Harry watches them, a thought forming.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What if there are two? Vanishing cabinets.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What if there are?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t know... Harry watches the twins vanish around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Good luck, mate. Harry turns back to Ron and Hermione, neither able to fully conceal heir concern. He smiles reassuringly, continues on. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 119 120 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 119.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t need luck. I’11 be with Dumbledore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Harry trots up the spiraling exterior stairs, he hears VOICES coming from the topmost level and pauses, peering up through the grid-like floor above: Dumbledore and Snape.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Have you ever considered that you ask too much? That you take too much for granted? Has it ever crossed your brilliant mind that I don’t want to do this anymore?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Whether it has or hasn’t is irrelevant. I will not negotiate this with you, Severus. You agreed. There’s nothing more to discuss. Harry stands poised, peering upward, where Dumbledore squints toward the dying sun and Snape glares at his back. Finally, Snape turns away and -- before Harry can react -- is descending the stairs. Seeing Harry, Snape falters briefly, then continues on without a word. As his FOOTSTEPS fade, Harry ascends to the upper tier. Dumbledore turns. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Harry. You need a shave, my friend. Harry runs his hand over his face.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: At times I forget how much you've grown. At times I still see the small boy from the cupboard. (smiling) Forgive my mawkishness, Harry. I am an old man.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You look the same to me, sir.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Like your mother, you are unfailingly kind. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 120.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A trait people never fail to undervalue. I’m afraid. Dumbledore turns then, eyes the fiery sky again.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: The place to which we journey tonight is exceedingly dangerous, Harry. I promised that you could accompany me and I stand by that promise. But there is a condition: You must obey any command I give you -- without question.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Understand what I’m saying. Should I tell you to hide, you must hide. Harry nods.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Should I tell you to run, you will run. Harry nods.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: And should I tell you to abandon me and save yourself... Harry’s eyes rise, meet Dumbledore’s.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: You will do so. Harry hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Your word, Harry. Harry debates this internally, then, finally, nods.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: My word.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Take my arm. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 120A.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sir, I thought one couldn't Apparate within Hogwarts.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Being me has its privileges. The WIND GUSTS and Harry reaches out. Dumbledore’s CLOAK BILLOWS and we are TOSSED INTO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK. Undulating. The sound of WAVES. We EASE UP, out of the ocean. A GIANT WAVE crashes over a jagged outcropping. As the SPRAY clears... Dumbledore and Harry are revealed. Dumbledore eyes the TOWERING CLIFF FACE opposite, the CAVE.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s there, isn’t it?  122 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 121.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Dumbledore materialize. It is quiet here, eerily so, the waves merely distant thunder. As Harry glances about, Dumbledore moves to an archway, passes beyond. Harry follows, finds Dumbledore standing below a towering dome of rock, probing its mysteries with the light from his wand.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: This is the place. Oh yes, this place has known magic. (closing his eyes) Where you stand, Harry, Tom Riddle once stood many, many years ago, when he was but a poor orphan boy with a penchant for cruelty... Dumbledore’s wand stops briefly in its arc and his face registers pain, as if detecting some past unpleasantry. He begins to TRACE HIS FINGERS over the surface of the rock.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: One wintry afternoon, he lured two younger classmates to this cave. What happened is unclear. But this much is known: the children were damaged. Dumbledore begins to MURMUR in a STRANGE WHISPER as his fingers play over the rock... then stop. His eyes open. He takes a dagger from his robes and draws the blade across his forearm, speckling the rock face with scarlet beads.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sir! The rock face SIZZLES like acid and begins to crumble, forming a narrow opening.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: In order to gain passage, payment must be made, payment intended to weaken any intruder.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You should've let me, sir.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Oh, no, Harry. Your blood is much more precious than mine.  123 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 122.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumbledore and Harry emerge onto the rim of a VAST LAKE teeming with MIST. A chill hangs in the air.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Careful. The water. Harry peers into the lake. It is black as ink.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Harry follows Dumbledore around the rim of the lake. In the center, a GREENISH GLOW shimmers in the mist.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: It’s there. The only question is how do we get to it?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We couldn’t, perhaps, just try a Summoning Charm, sir? Dumbledore smiles, motions: Be my guest. Harry lifts his wand.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Accio Horcrux! There is an EXPLOSION and something PALE erupts out of the water. Harry nearly sheds his skin. Dumbledore calmly watches it VANISH beneath the surface.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Perhaps not.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Dumbledore leads Harry on. Stops. Takes a step back. He CLOSES HIS EYES and to Harry’s horror walks right to the lake’s edge. As the dark water laps over the toes of his shoes, Dumbledore PASSES HIS HAND slowly through the air, then closes it... as if gripping something invisible. Taking his wand, he gives his CLENCHED FIST a TAP and a thick coppery-green CHAIN appears out of thin air, extending from the water to Dumbledore’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: If you would, Harry... Quickly Harry grasps the end of the chain and together he and Dumbledore pull, end over end, until the PROW of a SMALL BOAT pierces the surface, green with algae. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 123 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 123.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: In eerie silence, the boat cleaves the water, ferrying Harry and Dumbledore toward the GREENISH GLOW.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sir... have you ever taken Felix Felicis?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Only recreationally. You see, I believe one creates one’s own luck. Harry looks down into the water, watches a FACE skim by beneath the surface.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Professor... there are bodies in this lake.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Here the GREENISH GLOW is ferocious. As the boat arrives, Dumbledore steps out.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Remember... the water. Harry nods, steps out carefully and joins Dumbledore at the source of the GLOW -- a BASIN filled with a PHOSPHORESCENT LIQUID. Dumbledore extends the tips of his blackened fingers toward the basin, but cannot touch the liquid.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Do you think the Horcrux is in there, sir?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Oh yes. Dumbledore steps back, ponders the basin. Notes the CRYSTAL GOBLET sitting beside it. Smiles ruefully.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: It has to be drunk. (as Harry reacts) You remember the condition on which I brought you with me? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 124.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry starts to respond. Stops. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: This potion might paralyze me. It might cause me to forget why I’m here. It might create so much pain I beg for relief. You are not to indulge these requests, Harry. It is your job to make sure I keep drinking this potion even if you have to force it down my throat. Understood?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why can’t I drink it, sir?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Because I am much older, much cleverer... and much less valuable. (taking the goblet) Your good health, Harry. Dumbledore dips the goblet into the gleaming liquid and brings it to his lips. Drinks deep. Closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Professor? Dumbledore shakes his head, silencing Harry, then dips the goblet once more. Twice more he drinks. His hand TREMBLES and he grips the side of the basin.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Professor? Can you hear me? Dumbledore says nothing. The corners of his eyes TWITCH. His hand TREMBLES, savagely this time, and he nearly drops the goblet. Harry reaches out, steadies his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Don’t... don’t make me... Harry eyes Dumbledore’s anguished face, steels himself.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You... you can’t stop, Professor. You’ve got to keep drinking. Like you said. Remember.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Nooooooo! !! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 123 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 125.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry staggers back, so primal is Dumbledore’s plea. Dumbledore’s arm goes slack, the goblet clanging dully against the side of the basin. Harry takes a breath, steps forward, places his hand over Dumbledore’s, lifts the cup.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Make it stop... Please... make it stop...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It will, sir. It’ll stop. But only if you drink... Harry, his own hand TREMBLING now, tips the goblet over Dumbledore’s lips.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: My fault. It’s all my fault... Harry brings the goblet up once more. Dumbledore drinks.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Too much... I can’t... take it... I want... to die... kill... kill me... KILL ME, HARRY!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Your word, Harry! Your word!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: KILL ME
dialogues.text: Harry stands paralyzed, unsure what to do. Then... Dumbledore collapses, rolls onto his back. Harry pelts forward, dips the goblet into the basin and kneels by Dumbledore.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: One more. Just one more. And then -- I promise... I’11 do what you say. Dumbledore, jaw clinched shut, eyes Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I promise. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 123 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 126.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dumbledore’s jaw relaxes and Harry pries open his mouth, tips the liquid down his throat. Pain ripples through Dumbledore’s face. He tries to speak, Harry eyeing him with trepidation, fearful of what he will request. Again and again Dumbledore struggles and then... his eyes... open. Find Harry.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Water. A shudder of relief goes through Harry. Grinning, he leaps to the basin. A GOLDEN LOCKET now lies at the bottom. Harry snatches it up.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Water...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Aguamenti. Instantly COLD CLEAR WATER rises in the basin.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You did it, sir. Look -- Harry frowns. The goblet is empty.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Water! Harry dips the goblet into the basin yet again, brings it to Dumbledore’s lips... but once again finds it empty. Dumbledore tries to speak, but his lips are CRACKING, his tongue like SAND. He GULPS DRILY for air.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’m trying, sir. I’m -- Harry stops. All is silent... except for the SOFT LAPPING of the lake. He considers the GHOSTLY SHAPES gliding just below the surface. Deciding, he dips the goblet into the dark water. Instantly, the lake begins to CHURN. Harry backs away, the goblet sloshing in his hand. FACES, pale and haunted, quiver in the roiling water. Harry tips the water into Dumbledore’s mouth. Dumbledore blinks. His tongue probes his lower lip. Harry returns to the water’s edge, hesitates, then plunges the goblet into water once more. Instantly, a SLIMY WHITE HAND snags his wrist and Harry is pulled under. The goblet bobs on the surface. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 123 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 127.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERWATER
dialogues.text: Utterly silent. Harry twists madly as HANDS reach for him, turning him this way and that. HAUNTED FACES float by.

dialogues.speaker: THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: Harry breaks the surface, GASPING for air, blinking, catching a glimpse of Dumbledore slumped against the basin as he is...

dialogues.speaker: UNDERWATER
dialogues.text: «+. pulled underwater once again, into the eerie SILENCE of flailing arms. He shakes free again and again, but there are too many hands, too many haunted faces. We STAY UNDER a very long time, feel his lungs burning. His eyes lose their focus, turning blank. Bubbles trail out of his mouth as his face goes slack. He sinks deeper, in free fall, takes one last look at the SHIMMERING SURFACE ABOVE, the last thing he will see... when a SHADOW SHIVERS briefly and... «+. the SURFACE SIZZLES with RED LIGHT, like blood, then becomes TRANSPARENT, revealing DUMBLEDORE, wand pointed directly at the water.

dialogues.speaker: THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: Harry breaks the surface, SPITTING UP WATER, GASPING FOR AIR. Dumbledore staggers, slumps once more against the basin, weakened by his effort. Harry scrambles up, steadies him and the lake EXPLODES WITH FIRE. Harry wheels, watches the bodies in the lake twist in pain.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Go... Harry turns, confused. Dumbledore’s hand finds his face.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: We have to... go. Harry glances to the boat. Flames lick the prow, darkening the wood, but do not destroy it. He nods.  124 125 126 127 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 128.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Dumbledore emerge from the cave. Dumbledore, pale and weak, scans the stars wearily, leans heavily on Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, sir. We’re nearly there.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I am not worried, Harry. I am with you. A CHOIR IN FULL VOICE RISES ON THE AIR and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HOLD ON the Gothic glass of the main window. Ambient light, ominous and cool, plays across its shimmering surface. Flitwick, arms flowing gracefully, conducts a group of FIFTH YEARS, looks up toward the window, eyes the pulsating light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McGonagall stands in the courtyard as the CHOIR DRIFTS FAINTLY on the night air. She glances up to the sky, a curious expression on her face, then spies a pair of First Years straggling across the courtyard. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL To your Houses. No dawdling. As they scuttle off, McGonagall looks back to the sky. A VORTEX of CLOUDS swirls eerily in on itself. We PULL BACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++. out of a window, its glass prickling with ambient light, and find Snape standing silently, staring at the gathering storm, his expression inscrutable. The choir a murmur.  HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 129.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darker than usual. The fire muted. Ron and Hermione sit together. Silent. Glance toward the window, the sky beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Draco’s face, skin glimmering with the light crawling across the ceiling above him. He stares, unblinking, swings out of the bed. Bare feet -- Draco’s -- drop to the tiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The choir echoes eerily. SIXTH YEARS, little more than SHADOWS, hang out, giggling in dark corners. Malfoy glides by in his bare feet. Unnoticed. A ghost. 131 INT. ROOM OF REQUIREMENT —- NIGHT (MOMENTS LATER) 131 Dense with shadow. Strange slashes of light. Malfoy, a shadow within shadows, pulls the tapestry from the Vanishing Cabinet, steps back... He stares at the monolith before him, lifts his wand and begins to CHANT eerily. The surface of the cabinet glimmers, atremble in the ambient light. Almost alive. Then he stops. Looking back, his eyes haunted, he slips away. Light plays within the cabinet. Movement. Shadows flicker within, coalesce. We ease up, reveal... Bellatrix. Greyback. And a few friends. Bellatrix steps into the light. Glances around. Grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Dumbledore materialize on the rooftop. Dumbledore glances above, notes the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We need to get you up to the hospital, sir, to Madam Pomfrey --

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: No. Severus... Severus is who I need... Go and wake him... Tell him what has happened... (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 130.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Speak to no one else... I... shall wait here...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: All right. Okay. Harry gently disengages from Dumbledore, leaves him leaning against the ramparts. He dashes to the stairwell door and, glancing back, sees Dumbledore MUTTERING WEARILY as he GESTICULATES with his blackened hand.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sir, are you... praying?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: (smiling faintly) No, Harry. I do not pray. I was merely closing a window -- the one that had allowed us to Apparate. Harry nods, begins to open the door, when FOOTSTEPS sound. Draws his wand. Dumbledore cocks his head, listening. Wincing, he straightens up, as if to mask his infirmity.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Hide yourself below. And do not speak or show yourself without my permission. No matter what. Harry looks down, through the LATTICEWORK at his feet, to the tier below. The FOOTSTEPS DRAW CLOSER.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Do as I say, Harry. Harry hesitates. Dumbledore’s eyes blaze...

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Trust me. Harry meets Dumbledore’s eyes, then pockets his wand and slips down the stairs. As he reaches the level below, the DOOR above FLIES OPEN. Harry peers up through the grid, watches Malfoy come INTO VIEW.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Good evening, Draco. What brings you out on such a fine Spring evening? Or is it Summer? Draco stands poised, wand in hand, eyes darting about. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 131.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: Who else is here? I heard you talking.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I often talk aloud to myself. I find it extraordinarily useful. That which sounds sane at a whisper can seem utterly mad when said for all the world to hear. Haven’t been whispering to yourself, have you, Draco? Draco eyes Dumbledore with unease.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: You are not an assassin, Draco.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: How do you know what I am? I’ve done things that would shock you.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Like cursing Katie Bell and hoping she would, in turn, bear a cursed necklace to me? Like replacing a bottle of mead with one laced with poison. Forgive me, Draco, but these are attempts so feeble I cannot help but question if your heart has been really in them. I’m curious. When Voldemort gave you this task, when he asked you to kill me, was it in a whisper?

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: He trusts me! I was chosen! Malfoy thrusts out his arm, pulls back his sleeve and reveals the DARK MARK. Dumbledore barely looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Then I shall make it easy for you. Slowly and without intent, Dumbledore draws his wand. Instantly Malfoy raises his own.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: Expelliarumus! Harry watches in horror as Dumbledore’s wand flies free, clattering across the grid above. Malfoy watches it roll to a stop, a curious mixture of fear and awe at his own actions. Dumbledore eyes the wand, then Draco. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e  HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 131A.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Well done, Draco. But I warn you. Killing is not nearly as easy. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 132 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 132.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Malfoy looks into Dumbledore’s eyes, then to the sky, at the gathering clouds, twisting darkly, then glances to the stairwell. Dumbledore notices.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: You're not alone. Are you. There are others. How? A sneering smile plays over Malfoy’s lips.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: The Vanishing Cabinet in the Room of Requirement.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: That cabinet has been broken for years.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: I’ve been mending it.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Ingenious. Let me guess. It has a sister. A twin.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: In Borgin & Burkes. They form --

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: A passage, yes. Very good. (eyes shifting) I once knew a boy years ago who made all the wrong choices. Let me help you, Draco.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: I don’t want your help! Don’t you see! I have to do it! I have to! (in a whisper) I’ve got to kill you or he’1ll kill me.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Say that again, Draco. But aloud this time. Draco looks deep into Dumbledore’s eyes. His hand trembles. Transfixed, Harry watches from the shadows. Slowly, Malfoy begins to LOWER HIS WAND... when FOOTSTEPS ECHO. The DOOR FLIES OPEN: Bellatrix, Greyback and the others.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: Well now, look what we have here. Dumbledore. Wandless and alone. (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 133.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cornered in his own castle. Well done, Draco. Harry peers up, eyes flashing angrily at the sound of Bellatrix’s voice. He draws his wand slowly.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Good evening, Bellatrix. I think introductions are in order.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: Love to, Albus. But I’m afraid we're on a bit of a tight schedule. (to Malfoy) Do it. Malfoy’s wand rises once again. Harry raises his own, aiming through the grid, poised. Just then, a SHADOW splinters through the columns to his right. He looks, finds Snape, quiet as a ghost, peering upward. Carefully, Snape draws his wand, then turns to Harry, a finger to his lips: Shhh. Then he is drifting upward. Silent. A ghost again.

dialogues.speaker: GREYBACK
dialogues.text: He doesn’t have the stomach. Like his father. Let me finish him. In my own way.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: No! The Dark Lord was clear. The boy’s to do it. Go on, Draco. Now! Once again Draco raises his wand, his hand trembling. Harry’s own arm is stiff, sure. The vein in his hand pulsates...

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No. Harry watches Snape come INTO VIEW.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Severus...

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: Well, look who’s here. Hogwarts own Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher. Come to see the slaughter?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Severus... please. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: 132B
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 134.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: I gave my word. I made a vow... Harry’s eyes dart back and forth frantically, trying to make sense of the scene playing out above. Snape’s arm rises.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Avada Kedavra! A JET of GREEN LIGHT hits Dumbledore squarely in the chest. For a second he hangs, suspended upon the ramparts, and then... the night swallows him. HARRY SCREAMS in RAGE. Bellatrix raises her wand to the sky and a DEAFENING BLAST shakes the castle, masking Harry’s cry. The CLOUDS EXPLODE with GRIM LIGHT, mutating into a SKULL. As the Death Eaters flee, Snape’s arm drops limply to his side.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: You can no longer stay here. Draco, stunned, stares at the empty place where Dumbledore stood only seconds before. Snape takes him by the scruff of the neck, forces him through the door, then follows. Harry scrambles up the stairs and lurches to the ramparts, BATHED IN THE GREEN LIGHT from above. He peers down. Agony wrecks Harry’s face and he has to steady himself. He looks up into the leering skull above. Rage fills his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snape leads Malfoy and Bellatrix down the spiraling staircase. INT. SLUGHORN’S CORRIDOR - NIGHT 132B Snape leads on, his face a mask as he rounds a corner. STUDENTS in pajamas and robes peer at the emerald sky, then turn, stare curiously at their teacher and his companions. Snape sweeps past wordlessly. Draco averts his eyes. Bellatrix leers at a TINY FIRST YEAR, leans close:

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: Boo.

dialogues.speaker: 132H
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 134A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing FOOTSTEPS, an AUROR turns, is BLASTED off his feet as Snape and the others appear. Bellatrix lags, then steps to the TOWERING DOORS of the Hall, peering upward, past the FLOATING CANDLES to the vaulted ceiling, solemn as a church. Raising her wand, she sends a FIERY BOLT toward the GRAND WINDOW opposite. As it EXPLODES, a BLAST of COLD AIR sweeps the room, EXTINGUISHING THE CANDLES. Snape turns, looks back. Bellatrix simply GRINS, a mad child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bellatrix’s BLAST ECHOES, Ron and Hermione -- racing side by side in their regular clothes -- glance at one another, dash on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filch, on guard, looks up, watches SHARDS OF GLASS spill from the window like jewels, standing transfixed as the fragments lash his face, draw blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry races on, glances out a window and sees Snape and the others racing across a lower courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malfoy slows, glancing upward, watching the students come to the windows and peer out at the emerald sky. They look like ghosts in their nightclothes.

dialogues.speaker: BELLATRIX
dialogues.text: Draco! Draco! (as he turns) They’11 kill you if you stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione and Ron push through the other students, who are confused, crying. McGonagall appears, meets Ron and Hermione’s glance, continues on.  1321 133 134 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 134B. EXT. HAGRID’S HUT/GROUNDS - SAME TIME - NIGHT 1321 Quiet here. A VIEW TOWARD the castle. We HOLD. Slowly FIGURES appear on the horizon. The Death Eaters. Greyback. Bellatrix, Draco. And Snape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry bursts through the entrance doors, wand in hand. Before him, the grounds shimmer eerily in the GREEN GLOW. He sees the FIGURES FLEEING towards Hagrid’s Hut. EXT. HAGRID’S HUT / GROUNDS - SAME TIME - NIGHT 134 Snape and the others race toward the edge of the grounds. Suddenly, Snape pulls up, looks back. Sees Harry sprinting toward him. Malfoy, looking edgy, is watching Harry too.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Go on! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 134 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 135.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Just then a GIANT FIREBALL erupts into the sky. Snape wheels, sees Bellatrix and the others silhouetted against the flames. They’ve set Hagrid’s Hut ablaze. Malfoy stands paralyzed.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Go on!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Running. Harry bolts forth, wand in hand, vengeance in his eyes. Up ahead, Snape stands stolidly, tall and black against the raging fire. Harry points his wand, fires a JET of RED LIGHT. Snape doesn’t move, merely lets it streak by his head. Harry stops, chest heaving, and takes aim again.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Cruciatus! Snape raises his wand, parries the curse with ease.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Incacerata! Once again, Snape deflects the spell.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Impedimenta! Another lazy flick of the arm, another curse defeated. Harry drops his arm in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Fight! Fight back, you coward! With staggering quickness, Snape’s wand whips forth and Harry is off his heels and crashing to the earth.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Don’t ever associate that word and my name again. Harry raises himself up on one knee, points his wand when... a JET of RED LIGHT sends him crashing back into the grass. Snape wheels, sees Bellatrix standing behind.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: No! He belongs to the Dark Lord! Bellatrix eyes Snape levelly, then turns, trots off. Snape glances at Harry, then turns away himself, walking. Harry grimaces, pulls himself to his feet and aims one last time. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 136.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sectumsempra! Bang! Snape wheels and once more sends Harry flying onto his back. Harry stares at the stars as they wheel over him, when Snape comes INTO VIEW.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: You dare use my own spells against me, Potter? Harry goes still. His eyes shift, meet Snape’s.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: You may have gotten your mother’s eyes, but you’re as dim as your father. Yes. It’s me. I’m the Half-Blood Prince. Snape kicks Harry’s wand aside and turns away, joining Malfoy and the others where they wait beyond the flaming ruins of Hagrid’s Hut. They head for the darkness of the treeline. And VANISH. Harry pounds his fist into the ground, then stops.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hagrid... HAGRID! Harry races toward the hut when the DOOR flies off its hinges. Seconds later, Hagrid stumbles out, beard SMOKING.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hagrid! You alright?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Take more’n tha’ ter finish me off. Not sure about me ‘ouse, tho’. But if anybody can put it righ’, Dumbledore can.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hagrid, Dumbledore --

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Only thing I can’t reckon is wha’ Snape was doin’ with tha’ lot. Hagrid turns then, sees the HUGE THRONG of STUDENTS and STAFF assembled outside the castle. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: 136A
dialogues.text: 137 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 137.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: An’ wha’s this wi’ the Dark Mar’? Who’s been killed? (stopping) Where’s Dumbledore, ‘arry? Where's Dumbledore! ! Harry tries to speak, but he is mute. Hagrid goes still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, Hermione and Ginny stand with the staff. They turn and watch the throng of students part for Harry and Hagrid. Hagrid stops short, shattered by what he sees. Harry pushes on, kneels. Dumbledore’s eyes are closed, his face peaceful. Harry straightens his half-moon spectacles, wipes a trickle of blood from his mouth. Runs the back of his hand, gently, over the weathered cheek. Then he notices something lying beside Dumbledore’s ashen hand: the locket. He takes it, considers it numbly. Then begins to cry, great shudders of grief wracking his body. Hermione gives Ginny a nudge and she steps forward, drops beside him. At her touch, his head falls on her shoulder and she begins to stroke him. Ron looks on. Understands all. McGonagall lifts a trembling wand to the sky and slowly the TIP GLOWS to life. One after another, students and staff do the same, lifting their wands in salute. As CAMERA RISES, the pinpricks coalesce into one BLAZING FIRE. The sky, briefly emerald, turns black once more. The Dark Mark vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The castle sits silent. BLACK BANNERS fly on the parapets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silent. Desolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumbledore’s chair -- empty. The House tables -- empty.  HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 137A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tapestry tosses lightly in the breeze. The PERCH in the empty birdcage sways, SQUEAKING gently.  139 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 138. INT. DUMBLEDORE’S OFFICE - DAY 139 Quiet. Still. Empty. Then: The door eases OPEN and Harry enters. For a moment, he simply stands staring. Taking inventory. Spying something, he crosses to the great desk opposite. Looks down. Dumbledore’s wand. Reaching out, Harry takes it in hand. Old, oft-used and bearing the impression of its owner’s fingers, it is a strangely beautiful object. Harry traces his thumb lightly over the wood, transfixed, when... .«.. McGonagall enters. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Potter. He doesn’t respond, lost in the wand. McGonagall’s eyes drift to it, briefly, then study Harry’s face. She frowns, trying to call forth some words. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Potter, in light of what’s happened... should you feel the need to talk to someone... She falters. Harry gently sets the wand back upon the desk, retraces his steps to the door, pauses for one last look. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL You should know... Professor Dumbledore... Harry turns then, studying her drawn face, no words necessary. At a loss, she finishes quietly: PROFESSOR McGONAGALL You meant a great deal to him. Harry’s eyes rise. High upon the wall, the past Headmasters snooze in their frames. The last looks remarkably peaceful, the trace of a smile on his lips as he sleeps. Dumbledore. Harry nods, lingering one last moment, and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e  140 141 142 HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 138A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry stands at the window, alone in the empty dormitory. At the doorway, he looks back. As if committing it to memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry starts down the stairs, stops. Hermione, Ron and Ginny sit talking quietly. Ginny looks up. Smiles softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Hermione stand by the ramparts while Ron and Ginny stand further along, just out of earshot. Harry stares into the distance at the ashes of Hagrid’s Hut. Hermione toys with the locket before them.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Do you think he would’ve done it. Draco?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. He was lowering his wand. In the end, it was Snape. It was always Snape. And I did nothing... Hermione studies Harry, takes the locket from the rampart.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Strange. Thinking this is a piece of Voldemort’s soul...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, strange. Only... it’s not. It’s a fake. As Hermione reacts, Harry nods.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Go on. Open it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY POTTER... HALF-BLOOD PRINCE - Rev. 11/6/07 139.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hermione pries open the locket and removes a PARCHMENT folded in a tight square. READS:

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: ‘To the Dark Lord. I know I will be dead long before you read this but I want you to know that it was I who discovered your secret.
